boardgame.name: Cursus Honorum
boardgame.description:
In Cursus Honorum you lead your patrician family on a path to power, by occupying all offices in the progression of importance.

Roll your dice and move one of your family members according the number rolled. If it is on the right position, it can stop family members of your opponents.

If you are the first to get one of your family members to "Imperator", the game ends and you win.

—user summary

Published on History Kids, italian edition, issue #9.

boardgame.name: Before the First Emperor
boardgame.description:
The game takes place over the five hundred years of "Spring and Autumn Period" and "Warring States Period" in ancient China, before the power structure of old age undergone total collapse and the world was eventually taken over by the First Emperor of Qin.

Before the First Emperor is a euro-style game developed around two core mechanisms of "selective worker placement" and "variable resource generation". Players are provided with multiple paths to victory.

In their turn, each player can place workers on one of the 12 action spaces on the main board and perform the corresponding actions, or place them in their own Domain tiles to generate resources. They can also fulfil contracts and use special powers as free actions.

After 8 to 10 rounds the game comes to a conclusion. Players sum up points gained from their contracts, Virtue Tracks, Provinces, Fiefs, office buildings and the King's Favours to determine who's the First Emperor.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: History: Warring States Period of China

Exciting questions on funny categories await you here to put your knowledge to the test and challenge the other girls. Scratch the questions, win the mini-games, and get your brain in gear. boardgame.name: Geisterwald & Knochenklippen
boardgame.description:
Klappentext

Ghost Forest & Bone Cliffs is a game aid for The Shores of the Godwhale - Thorwal & the Gjalskerland and contains further information and additional rules for the game in the Highlands of the Barbarians.

This game aid includes new animist powers, weapon spells, and a secondary tradition artifact for animists, the Claw Necklace. For Gjalsk shamans, it offers more liturgies, new abilities for the bone club, and another ceremonial item in the form of the spirit fetish.

A small bestiary gives you an overview of the game values of all animal spirit patrons selectable for Gjalsk animists that are not already included in the regional game guide, and adds the strong mammoth and the fearsome saber-toothed tiger.

In addition, Ghost Forest & Bone Cliffs contains detailed focus rules for training animals and the highland games of the Gjalsk people, called the Palenkel. To use this game aid, in addition to the rulebook and the Aventurian Almanac, The Shores of the Godwhale - Thorwal & the Gjalskerlands is required.


Klappentext

Geisterwald & Knochenklippen ist eine Spielhilfe für Die Gestade des Gottwals – Thorwal & das Gjalskerland und beinhaltet weiterführende Informationen und zusätzliche Regeln für das Spiel im Hochland der Barbaren.

Diese Spielhilfe enthält neue Animistenkräfte, Waffenzauber und mit der Krallenkette auch ein sekundäres Traditionsartefakt für Animisten. Für Gjalskerschamanen bietet sie weitere Liturgien, neue Fähigkeiten für die Knochenkeule und mit dem Geisterfetisch einen weiteren Zeremonialgegenstand.

Ein kleines Bestiarium gibt dir eine Übersicht über die Spielwerte aller für Gjalsker Animisten wählbaren Tiergeist-Patrone, die nicht bereits in der Regionalspielhilfe enthalten sind, und ergänzt sie um das starke Mammut und den furchteinflößenden Säbelzahntiger.

Darüber hinaus enthält Geisterwald & Knochenklippen ausführliche Fokusregeln zum Abrichten von Tieren und die Hochlandspiele der Gjalsker, das sogenannte Palenkel. Zur Benutzung dieser Spielhilfe wird außer dem Regelwerk und dem Aventurischen Almanach auch Die Gestade des Gottwals – Thorwal & das Gjalskerland vorausgesetzt.

With this unique quiz night you can quiz your knowledge, because the quiz game puts young and old to the test. Scratch the questions free and challenge yourself in a variety of categories. The exciting mini-games will really get your brain working! Which team knows more, who is faster - who comes out the winner? boardgame.name: Meisterschirmset - Schicksalsschwur und Skaldensang
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

Schicksalsschwur & Skaldensang is a game aid for The Shores of the Godwhale - Thorwal & the Gjalskerland and offers on 48 pages a wealth of game material for exciting adventures in the wind- and sea-swept northwest of Aventuria: 3 short adventures and several game aids, including a typical Ottaskin, inner-Aventurian legends of the Gjalsker, game aids to Godi, Skalden, as well as the language of the Thorwaler and Gjalsker with a detailed language glossary each.

In addition to the eponymous game aid Schicksalsschwur & Skaldensang, the master umbrella set with Auf ins Abenteuer - Die Gestade des Gottwals contains 32 pages of six ready-to-play archetypes from the shores of the God Whale and the adventure Treueschwur. The adventure takes the heroes to Torstorsgard, the second oldest settlement of Thowal, where they assist the Hersirin of one of the clans settling there and investigate an ancient mystery.

In addition, the Master Screen Set - Oath of Fate & Scaldensong comes with six insert pages for the TDE Universal Player's Guide. Three of these pages show the cover motifs of the regional game help The Shores of the Godwhale, the Armory of the Shores of the Godwhale and the adventure Runes of Destiny. The other three pages contain useful tables for playing on the shores of the Godwhale, such as the typical regional designations for the course of the year or rules overviews for shipping or the Palenkel of the Gjalsk.

In addition to the rulebook and the Aventurian Almanac, The Shores of the Godwhale - Thorwal & the Gjalskerland is required to use this game aid. For optimal use of the inlay pages, the TDE Universal Game Guide is recommended.


Klappentext

Schicksalsschwur & Skaldensang ist eine Spielhilfe für Die Gestade des Gottwals – Thorwal & das Gjalskerland und bietet auf 48 Seiten eine Fülle an Spielmaterial für spannende Abenteuer im von Wind und Gischt umtosten Nordwesten Aventuriens: 3 Kurzabenteuer und mehrere Spielhilfen, darunter eine typische Ottaskin, inneraventurische Legenden der Gjalsker, Spielhilfen zu Godi, Skalden, sowie der Sprache der Thorwaler und Gjalsker mit jeweils einem ausführlichen Sprachglossar.

Neben der namensgebenden Spielhilfe Schicksalsschwur & Skaldensang enthält das Meisterschirmset mit Auf ins Abenteuer – Die Gestade des Gottwals auf 32 Seiten sechs spielfertige Archetypen von den Gestaden des Gottwals und das Abenteuer Treueschwur. Das Abenteuer führt die Helden nach Torstorsgard, die zweitälteste Siedlung Thowals, wo sie der Hersirin einer der dort siedelnden Sippen beistehen und ein altes Mysterium ergründen.

Außerdem liegen dem Meisterschirmset – Schicksalsschwur & Skaldensang noch sechs Einlegerseiten für den DSA5 Universal-Spielleiterschirm bei. Diese zeigen auf drei Seiten die Covermotive der Regionalspielhilfe Die Gestade des Gottwals, der Rüstkammer der Gestade des Gottwals und des Abenteuers Runen des Schicksals. Die anderen drei Seiten enthalten nützliche Tabellen für das Spiel an den Gestaden des Gottwals wie die regionaltypischen Bezeichnungen für den Jahreslauf oder regeltechnische Übersichten für die Schifffahrt oder die Palenkel der Gjalsker.

Zur Benutzung dieser Spielhilfe wird neben dem Regelwerk und dem Aventurischen Almanach auch Die Gestade des Gottwals – Thorwal & das Gjalskerland vorausgesetzt. Für die optimale Benutzung der Einlegerseiten wird der DSA5 Universal-Spielleiterschirm empfohlen.

boardgame.name: Mittsommerrache
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

The coast of Thorwal has a primal beauty and wildness. But not only the inhabitants of this rough stretch of land can sometimes become uncomfortable. The same applies to Efferd, the capricious god of the sea. With great difficulty, the crew of the Liaiella II manages to escape into a fjord in the midst of a violent storm. The small merchant ship has been badly battered by Efferd's ravages, and there is no thought of continuing the journey for the time being. Fortunately, there is a small village on the shore of the fjord whose inhabitants, after initial mistrust, are willing to help the stranded crew repair the ship.

While the work is in full swing, it is revealed that the village has its own unique problems to deal with. The very superstitious villagers see everywhere messengers of their impending doom, and indeed there is a lot wrong: goats disappear from the pastures, the meager harvest spoils from one day to the next, a monster nests in the fjord, so that the fishermen no longer dare to go fishing, and the local Swafnir devotee is seriously ill and unresponsive. When two young people go missing, quick action is required.

It is up to the heroes to find out if the superstition of the villagers is justified and if the village is really doomed, or if there is another explanation for the events.

A TDE group adventure for 3-5 heroes.

Adventure keywords: a remote village by a fjord, superstitious population, eerie events, missing people, a vengeful exile
Genre: detective and wilderness adventure
Requirements: no exotics, wilderness and battle-tested heroines
Location: village in the west of the Premer Peninsula (fjord between Hjalsingor and Rovik)
Time: Anytime from 1042 BF
Complexity (players/masters): low to medium / medium
Experience of heroes: average to experienced
Requirements: Willingness to help, fighting skills
Social talents 3/4
Combat 2/4
Knowledge talents 2/4
Living History 1/4

To play you only need the Dark Eye rulebook. For more in-depth background, the Almanac and Shores of the Godwhale is recommended. For details such as city maps, descriptions of places and information on individual master characters, please refer to the aforementioned game aid, all other information is contained in this volume.


Klappentext

Der Küste Thorwals wohnt eine urtümliche Schönheit und Wildheit inne. Doch nicht nur die Bewohner dieses rauen Landstrichs können mitunter ungemütlich werden. Gleiches gilt für Efferd, den launischen Gott des Meeres. Mit Mühe und Not kann sich die Besatzung der Liaiella II. inmitten eines heftigen Sturms in einen Fjord retten. Das kleine Handelsschiff wurde von Efferds Toben schwer gezeichnet, und an eine Weiterfahrt ist vorerst nicht zu denken. Zum Glück gibt es ein kleines Dorf am Ufer des Fjords, dessen Bewohner nach anfänglichem Misstrauen bereit sind, der gestrandeten Besatzung bei der Reparatur des Schiffes zu helfen.

Während die Arbeiten im vollen Gange sind, offenbart sich, dass das Dorf mit ganz eigenen Problemen zu kämpfen hat. Die sehr abergläubischen Dorfbewohner sehen überall Boten ihres drohenden Untergangs, und tatsächlich liegt einiges im Argen: Ziegen verschwinden von den Weiden, die karge Ernte verdirbt von einem Tag auf den nächsten, ein Monster nistet sich im Fjord ein, sodass sich die Fischer nicht mehr zum Fischfang hinaustrauen, und die örtliche Swafnirgeweihte liegt schwerkrank darnieder und ist nicht ansprechbar. Als schließlich auch noch zwei Jugendliche vermisst werden, ist schnelles Handeln gefragt.

Es ist an den Helden, aufzuklären, ob der Aberglaube der Dorfbevölkerung begründet ist und das Dorf tatsächlich dem Untergang geweiht ist, oder ob es für die Vorkommnisse eine andere Erklärung gibt.

Ein DSA-Gruppenabenteuer für 3-5 Helden

Stichworte zum Abenteuer: ein abgelegenes Dorf an einem Fjord, abergläubische Bevölkerung, unheimliche Ereignisse, verschwundene Menschen, ein rachsüchtiger Verbannter
Genre: Detektiv- und Wildnisabenteuer
Voraussetzungen: keine Exoten, wildnis- und kampferprobte Heldinnen
Ort: Dorf im Westen der Premer Halbinsel (Fjord zwischen Hjalsingor und Rovik)
Zeit: beliebig ab 1042 BF
Komplexität (Spieler/Meister): gering bis mittel / mittel
Erfahrung der Helden: durchschnittlich bis erfahren
Anforderungen: Hilfsbereitschaft, Kampfkraft
Gesellschaftstalente 3/4
Kampf 2/4
Wissenstalente 2/4
Lebendige Geschichte 1/4

Zum Spielen benötigt ihr lediglich das Das Schwarze Auge Regelwerk. Zur Vertiefung des Hintergrunds wird der Almanach und Gestade des Gottwals empfohlen. Für Details wie Stadtkarten, Beschreibungen von Orten und Informationen zu einzelnen Meisterpersonen wird auf die genannte Spielhilfe verwiesen, alle weiteren Informationen sind in diesem Band ent-halten.

boardgame.name: Runen des Schicksals
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

The fate of each person is predetermined by the Runjas, every Thorwalian knows that. But just because the destination is certain, one does not know the route. Thus, the seers of the north often consult their runes to interpret the will of fate. The most legendary runes, however, which Jurga Tjalfsdottir received as a gift from Swafnir himself, have long since become the stuff of songs and sagas. But what if they really existed? What if there is a grain of truth in the stories about Jurga's lost brother, who wanted to reveal the true fate of the Thorwals with the runes? The search for such a mystical treasure would truly be worth a saga of its own. But only intrepid, weatherproof, and highly adaptable heroes would be able to follow the trail of destiny on a path that could take them beyond the borders of Thorwal....
Are you these rekkers? Do you have what it takes to brave the sea as well as the icy mountains? Do you have the grit to negotiate with scrappy seafarers, eerie alpine creatures, and headstrong barbarians? Are your blades sharp enough to conquer the dark terrors of the north? Then set out in search of the Runes of Destiny. May the Runjas guide you!


Klappentext

Das Schicksal eines jeden Menschen wird von den Runjas vorherbestimmt, das weiß jeder Thorwaler. Doch nur weil das Ziel gewiss ist, kennt man noch lange nicht den Reiseweg. So befragen die Seher des Nordens oft ihre Runen, um den Willen des Schicksals zu deuten. Die legendärsten Runen aber, die Jurga Tjalfsdottir von Swafnir selbst geschenkt bekam, sind längst nur noch Stoff für Lieder und Sagas. Was aber, wenn es sie wirklich gab? Wenn in den Geschichten um Jurgas verschollenen Bruder, der mit den Runen das wahre Schicksal der Thorwaler offenbaren wollte, ein Körnchen Wahrheit steckt? Die Suche nach einem solch mystischen Schatz wäre wahrhaft eine eigene Saga wert. Doch nur unerschrockene, wetterfeste und sehr anpassungsfähige Helden wären wohl in der Lage, auf den Spuren des Schicksals einem Pfad zu folgen, der sie über die Grenzen Thorwals hinaus führen könnte …
Seid ihr diese Rekker? Habt ihr das Zeug, der See ebenso zu trotzen wie den eisigen Bergen? Habt ihr den Schneid, mit rauflustigen Seeleuten, schauerlichen Alfengestalten und eigensinnigen Barbaren zu verhandeln? Sind eure Klingen scharf genug, um die finsteren Schrecken des Nordens zu bezwingen? Dann begebt euch auf die Suche nach den Runen des Schicksals. Mögen die Runjas euch führen!

boardgame.name: Glaube, Macht & Heldenmut: Die Gestade des Gottwals
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

Equipped with faith, power and heroism, the heroes of the Shores of the Godwhale set out on adventures. While the Thorwals are bound by faith in their god Swafnir, the shamans of the Gjalsk serve many deities, led by the mammoth god Natûru-Gon. Brave warriors and rekkers defend their ottajasko from all manner of dangers or roam the moors and highlands of the Gjalsk as animal warriors. In the mage academies of Thorwal and Olport, mages pursue the exploration of the elements and the analysis of magical phenomena, while the magical spell bards, called sangara in Thorwal, move from place to place, sowing discord or making peace in the name of the Swafnir's son Ögnir.

In this focus rule supplement to The Shores of the Godwhale, you gain talent, combat, spell, and liturgy styles, as well as expanded special skills for the traditions and professions presented in the regional game guide.

To use Faith, Might & Valor: The Shores of the Godwhale, you only need The Shores of the Godwhale, The Black Eye rulebook, and the Aventurian Almanac. All other necessary rules are included.


Klappentext

Ausgestattet mit Glaube, Macht und Heldenmut ziehen die Helden der Gestade des Gottwals auf Abenteuer aus. Während die Thorwaler durch den Glauben an ihren Gott Swafnir verbunden sind, dienen die Schamanen der Gjalsker vielen Gottheiten, angeführt vom Mammutgott Natûru-Gon. Tapfere Krieger und Rekkerinnen verteidigen ihre Ottajasko vor allerlei Gefahren oder streifen als Tierkrieger durch die Moore und das Hochland der Gjalsker. In den Magierakademien von Thorwal und Olport gehen die Magier der Erkundung der Elemente und der Analyse magischer Phänomene nach, während die magischen Zauberbarden, die man in Thorwal Sangara nennt, von Ort zu Ort ziehen und im Namen des Swafnirsohnes Ögnir Zwietracht säen oder Frieden stiften.

In dieser Fokusregelergänzung zu Die Gestade des Gottwals erhältst du Talent-, Kampf-, Zauber- und Liturgiestile, sowie erweiterte Sonderfertigkeiten für die in der Regionalspielhilfe vorgestellten Traditionen und Professionen.

Zur Nutzung von Glaube, Macht & Heldenmut: Die Gestade des Gottwals benötigst du lediglich Die Gestade des Gottwals, Das Schwarze Auge Regelwerk sowie den Aventurischen Almanach. Alle weiteren notwendigen Regeln sind enthalten.

boardgame.name: Fruddel Muddel
boardgame.description:
Do red bananas feel as blue as yellow strawberries?! Anyone who plays Fruddel Muddel must overlook the muddle of colors in front of them to grab the right fruit.

To set up, deal cards are evenly as possible to all players, then place the four fabric fruits — strawberry, banana, pear, and grapes — in the center of the playing area so that everyone can grab them easily.

Everyone then reveals a card simultaneously, and each card shows the silhouette of one of these four fruits, with an outline in the color of one of these four fruits on a colored background that matches one of these four fruits — which means that each card has elements of three different fruits or two elements of one fruit and one element of a second fruit. Your challenge is to figure out which fruit appears most frequently among all the signals given, then grab it from the center. Alternatively, if you don't want to grab something, place your hand on your deck of cards.

If you grabbed the proper fruit — and more than one might exist! — then you place your revealed card on the bottom of your deck. If you didn't grab a fruit, you discard your card, and if you grabbed the wrong fruit, discard your card and one additional card from your deck. Keep playing rounds until someone discards their final card, at which point whoever has the most cards left wins.

boardgame.name: Escape the Box: Der verfolgte Sherlock Holmes
boardgame.description:
Should the great Sherlock Holmes have fallen victim to one of his many enemies? For Watson and his companions, the search for the missing genius becomes their greatest case. A breathless chase through the foggy alleys of London begins, from mysterious crime scenes to behind the doors of secretive gentlemen's clubs. Can they uncover Moriarty's plot before it's too late?

Using dividers and floor cards, you'll transform the game boxes into a unique setting for your Sherlock Holmes mystery. Solve all the puzzles and unravel the secrets inside and outside the box to find the missing consulting detective. This Escape Room will show you if you have what it takes to take on the London underworld.

-description by the publisher

boardgame.name: Epic Encounters: Tower of the Lich Empress
boardgame.description:
Climb a never-ending tower to confront an ancient evil with this hair-raising Epic Encounters boss box! Compatible with fifth edition or any fantasy roleplaying game.

The endless staircase finally gives way to an enormous ornate door. Intense evil emanates from the room beyond: a Lich Empress. An ancient creature — once a wizard, now something entirely different. Something unnatural, clinging to life through dark magic. Something that does not die. Its translucent skin reveals atrophied muscle beneath; its brain a shrivelled vessel for the forbidden lore of civilisations past.

It does not die. But it watches. And it waits.
Inside this boss box, you’ll find everything you need to challenge the formidable Lich Empress, including a large, highly detailed Lich Empress miniature (100mm base!) and an adventure book woven with information to fuel your imagination.

Can you ascend the tower and kill that which does not die? Use Tower of the Lich Empress as a standalone encounter or as part of a new or existing RPG campaign!

boardgame.name: Epic Encounters: Arena of the Undead Horde
boardgame.description:
Venture into a crumbling arena of undead gladiatorial combat with this Epic Encounters warband box!

In the heart of a ruined city stands a giant, mouldering arena. The crowd’s raucous jeers echo endlessly round this sinister coliseum. But their savage cries are not borne of living throats. Skeletons, spectres, and shambling hordes of undead stand witness to a gladiatorial contest between their human captives. Perhaps it’s jealousy that drives their bloodlust. Or maybe cruel joy at seeing another spark extinguished. Whatever their motive, they’re out there. Cheering your impending death. Will you survive the Arena of the Undead Horde?

Inside this warband box, you’ll find everything you need to challenge the Undead Horde, including 20 highly detailed minis and an adventure book woven with information to fuel your imagination.

Can you survive the arena? Use Arena of the Undead Horde as a standalone encounter or as part of a new or existing RPG campaign!

boardgame.name: Unboxing: Der Fluch des Seeungeheuers
boardgame.description:
Ahoy, you landlubbers! Dive into a bygone era full of robbery, rum and brawls.
During a dive you discover a strange box on the seabed. You bring it onto your boat and try to open it. It turns out that there are a lot more secrets hidden inside than you first thought. With the help of a magic shell, you'll witness strange happenings on a pirate ship where little is as it seems.
So it's all hands on deck: solve the riddles, listen carefully to the radio play and uncover the mystery, box by box.

-description by the publisher

listing.notes:
Original German version. I doubt there's another one.
(Outer) Box shows little wear. Inside everything there in great condition. Played once without destroying / damaging anything. Everything 'reset' afterwards - ready to be played again.

boardgame.name: Ist da wer?!
boardgame.description:
Ist da wer?! is a hide-and-seek game in which attentive children need to recognize what cannot be seen.

The centerpiece of the game is a "thicket", that is, a large vertical container that represents a bunch of bushes. Inside this container are twenty wooden discs, two each of ten colors, and you can see these discs inside the thicket through 29 cut-out slots. However, the thicket is designed so that five of the discs will fall into grooves at the bottom of the vertical container, and the discs in these grooves will be hidden by a piece of cardboard underbrush so that they are not visible until you remove the underbrush during play. Ten animals in the colors of the discs are set up in the center of the playing area within reach of all players. Each player also has a stack of nine tiles that when placed together form a picture.

Each round, one player shakes the thicket face down so that no one can see which discs are going where, then they stand the thicket upright on the table. Everyone then grabs for the animals that they think are hiding in the underbrush, that is, the animals that can be seen only once through the cut-out slots — or possibly not seen at all.

Once everyone has grabbed all the animals that they wish to, remove the underbrush to see which animals are actually there. If you grabbed an animal that is in the underbrush, reveal one of your picture tiles, and if that animal is in the underbrush twice, reveal two picture tiles instead. If by mistake you grabbed an animal that is not in the underbrush, you must return a picture tile to the bottom of your stack. Keep playing rounds until one or more players have revealed all of their tiles, completed their picture, and won.

The cards are inspired by nature and the illustrations are by elm of elm island.

The first edition is self published and limited to 100 copies.

boardgame.name: Квилт
boardgame.description:
So, each player is an unsurpassed master and will create a real work of art today, while earning as many victory points as possible. Quilt is a game for all family members, great for both beginners and experienced players who can enjoy finding a tactical game plan and making various combos.

The essence of the game:

We pull out pencils from the bag and distribute them among the needle beds, and then take them apart for ourselves.
We color, with the received pencils, the cells of our quilt.
Activate chains of effects and collect bonuses.


It turned out to be an unusual logic game in a tempting warm cover.

boardgame.name: Dragons (Chromatic)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A chromatic dragon is meant to be a terrifying encounter for any adventuring party; power, resistance, and magic to shock and awe. This supplmenet provides 5 new templates that make dragons into sphere champions, making them both more unforgettable and easier to run. For Pathfinder 1st edition and utilizing the Spheres of Power and Spheres of Might systems.

boardgame.name: Polymorph: The Martial Master (PF1)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this book you will get a full 1-20 class that is conceptually a hybrid class of the monk, barbarian and swashbuckler classes. While you will see elements of each of the "parent" classes, they are introduced in a fresh way that brings a new way to approach martial combat. In addition to the base class you will get three archetypes to provide some tweaks on how the class is handled and new feats that compliment the class. All-in-all the martial master will provide an excellent class for those players seeking a new, more measured and interesting martial class or for GMs to provide a challenging combatant.

boardgame.name: Pax Londinium: Welcome to The South Side
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You’ve seen the Pax in action in London, how it divides the Hidden World within the city between areas north and south of the river. Because of this some believe the south of London to be mundane, without the magical wonders and dangers of north of the Thames.

Contains:

What goes on South of the River in Liminal London.
The law of the Hidden World that divides north and south London, and why south of the river supernatural activity is required to be more subtle.
Featuring fairs, boggarts, rookeries, and the Imperial War Museum!

boardgame.name: The Oak and the Amulet
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The crew receive an anonymous note reading, “The werewolves are going to chase down and kill a man tomorrow night on top of Ilkley Moor.” Werewolves killing people? And who sent the note? There’s time pressure to find out if the crew are going to help.

Contains:

A case note for Liminal suitable for both a one-shot and a continuing campaign.
Links to werewolf politics and an ancient faerie gift.
Based in the North Yorkshire moors.

boardgame.name: The Dire Skunk
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Known for their ferocity and terrible vision, dire skunks are extremely dangerous for any adventurer foolish enough - or unlucky enough - to cross their path. Like their normal-sized cousins, their favored defense is an incredibly noxious and odiferous spray from a scent gland beneath their tail.

This PDF contains the lore and stats needed to run the Dire Skunk in your game, along with a 1-page fully-prepared encounter and illustrated monster handout.

boardgame.name: Unboxing: Das Geheimnis des Meisterdiebs
boardgame.description:
For almost ten years, a box lay unnoticed in your police station's evidence room. What is this strange box all about? Is it really from a master thief, as the lead detective claims? And what is really inside? Solve the riddles, listen carefully to the radio play and find out the secret, box by box.

-description by the publisher

boardgame.name: Sailors on the Starless Sea Limited Edition
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Limited edition foil hardcover with over 30 pages of extra content from the original DCC #067: Sailors on the Starless Sea.
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Libertalia: Auf den Winden von Galecrest
Libertalia: De Winden Van Galecrest
Libertalia: Fellegbérc szelei
Libertalia: Les Vents de Galecrest
Libertalia: Piráti vzduchomoří
Libertalia: Vientos de Galecrest
Libertalia: Wichry Galecrest
Libertalia: Winds of Galecrest
boardgame.description:
In the world of Galecrest, sky pirates set sail on the winds in search of adventure, treasure, and glory. As an admiral, you command a vast and varied crew...but so do your rivals sailing other ships in the pirate fleet. Each day the fleet lands on a different island where you'll send a crew member to collect your share of the loot, hoping they'll return to boost your growing group of characters.

Libertalia was originally released in 2012. Ten years later, Libertalia: Winds of Galecrest celebrates the foundations of the original design with a revised and expanded edition that includes all-new art, 40 characters per player, a reputation system to resolve tiebreakers, deluxe loot tokens, a robust solo mode, and much more.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Sly Foxes
boardgame.description:
Sly Foxes is a super fun and highly strategic card game in which you have to outsmart the other players… ughm… I mean foxes! You can do that with the help of a hedgehog hug, nosy weasels, pouring vodka instead of water, giving long-forgotten cookies and many more! We don't have unicorns, explosions or kittens, but if you're into foxes, turtles, NINJA-DEER, rabbits, squirrels and other cute animals, then try this game!

The cards get separated into 2 decks - attack and defence cards. There are special cards too, like ‘I don't care’ which protects you against attacks and nosey weasels, who in turn interfere during other players' turns. In the beginning each player has 3 lives, gets 3 cards from each deck and a secret character that helps them in certain situations.

When it's your turn you either draw a card or attack a player of your choice. The player who eliminates everyone else wins the game and gets proclaimed the slyest fox in the woods. You can also play the game in teams and this makes it even more fun!

boardgame.name: Terra Mystica: Fan Factions
boardgame.description: A collection of 16 new factions for Terra Mystica, 2 each for the 7 colors of the game and 2 multi-color factions. All ideas submitted by fans of the game.

boardgame.name: Lost Ruins of Arnak + Expedition Leaders: GeekyGameyGadgets Insert/Organizer
boardgame.description:
Laser cut organizer for your copy of Lost Ruins of Arnak the board game with its expansion, Expedition Leaders. (For just the base game, see our other listing.)

This custom MDF insert holds all the pieces for the Lost Ruins of Arnak and its expansion. Game setup is faster because trays rest directly on the board. No need to stack temple tiles in a perfect pyramid -- just use the tray!

Trays include customized engravings depicting their contents, so it's easy to see what goes where.

Allows game to be stored however you want: horizontally or vertically. Plenty of space for both the base game and the expansion in the same box, perfectly organized. Although the card tray doesn't fit sleeved cards, the tray's dividers can be removed to place stacks of sleeved cards inside if desired.

Arrives with all pieces punched out and ready for assembly. Does not include the game itself nor its expansion. Includes instructions and plenty of email support so you won't worry about encountering any issues.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Lost Ruins of Arnak: Expedition Leaders

boardgame.name: Dicewar
boardgame.description:
What happens when a classic 5-dice game meets high-intensity action card play? A battle for the best roll. DICEWAR invigorates dice-rolling with a ground-breaking fervor and hostility that will make you forget everything you ever knew about dice.

Dicewar is a round-by-round competition to be the first player to reach 6 points. To have any chance at the win, players must balance strong dice-rolling with strategic action card playing.

2-5 players are given 3 rolls per round to achieve familiar dice combinations like Large Straight, 4-of-a-kind, and Full House. The player with the best roll at the end of a round wins a point AND and action card. With 10 different action card types, players can use cards to steal dice from their opponents, skip their opponents' turn, and even make their opponent "respect the ones".

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Volto
boardgame.description:
The next Doge of Venice is about to be elected: two families are in line to see their representative prevail.
During the carnival, everyone wears masks, so it's the perfect opportunity for your family to eliminate the rival family.

Discredit the opposing contender in St Mark's Square to ensure the council's vote!

Your family takes advantage of the Venice Carnival to get rid of your rival for the title of Doge.


Secretly deploy your forces in St Mark's Square
Fight the rival family
Discredit your opponent in public.


Which family will succeed?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Thing: Human Miniatures Set
boardgame.description:
The Thing – The Boardgame is an intense game experience for 1-8 players based on the 1982 cult movie directed by John Carpenter. It is a game that mixes different mechanics to create an experience that is as faithful as possible to that of the original movie.

The Thing: Human miniatures expansion contains a set of eight highly detailed character miniatures, to use in place of the Characters standees you can find into the base game box.

These miniatures represent the 8 main characters seen in the movie, such as MacReady or Doctor Blair.

Using these Character miniatures in place of the standees enriches the game, giving it a more scenic aspect and a stronger impact to the gameplay.

boardgame.name: Gunslinger
boardgame.description: Gunslinger is a science-fantasy roleplaying game of strange science in the Wild West, it is compatible with the Original Fantasy Roleplaying game, Warriors of the Red Planet, and related systems.

boardgame.name: Hitler's Stalingrad: Breslau 1945
boardgame.description:
After being cut off and isolated in mid-February 1945, the German garrison at Breslau, some 50,000 men, defied all odds holding onto the city for almost a week AFTER Berlin fell! Hitler had ordered the city be held at all costs, believing Soviet forces tied up there were thus not taking part in any assault on Berlin. The defending garrison finally surrendered just days before the war officially ended (with the Gauleiter in charge fleeing the city by air to escape capture).

Taking the city fell to the Soviet Sixth Army, comprised of some eight divisions with 80,000 men between them, plus four tank regiments and two artillery divisions. An entire Air Army, the Second, was also assigned to provide ample destructive power from the sky. The task facing the Soviets was daunting; urban warfare plus a very determined defender. Terrain too was critical - the Oder River flowing through the city sliced it up into many parts. Taking a major sector of the city could mean nothing more than occupying an "island" in the end.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: Hitler's Stalingrad: Breslau February to May 1945

boardgame.name: Golden Journal Number 42 Midway: Battleship-Carriers
boardgame.description:
Japanese Navy considered a radical plan to replenish and increase its carrier fleet: convert all ten of its older battleships to aircraft carriers. That would be scaled back to just the hybrid conversions of Ise and Hyuga, but not in the Golden Journal.

Meanwhile, the Americans drafted plans of their own (which still exist) to convert the hulls of Iowa-class battleships, Alaska-class large cruisers and Baltimore-class heavy cruisers into aircraft carriers. When it became clear that plenty of Essex-class carriers would join the fleet before those conversions could be made, the project was dropped (except for the conversion of nine Cleveland-class light cruisers).

Battleship-Carriers includes 20 new “long” ship pieces, 10 of them Japanese, 10 of them American, all of them our standard, beautiful die-cut and silky-smooth tiny works of art.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Avalanche Press Gold Club Golden Journal Supplements
Series: Second World War at Sea (Avalanche Press)

boardgame.name: Second Great War at Sea: River Plate
boardgame.description:
In August 1939, the German armored cruiser Admiral Graf Spee set out from Germany for the South Atlantic Ocean. Several weeks after the German invasion of Poland, she began to attack Allied merchant shipping. British and French warships scoured the South Atlantic in search of the German cruiser.

After sinking nine merchant vessels totaling just over 50,000 tons’ displacement, Admiral Graf Spee steamed to the waters off Argentina’s River Plate estuary. Instead of more undefended shipping, she found three British cruisers. Despite the heavier guns of the German ship, Admiral Graf Spee lost the encounter and fled for the neutral port of Montevideo, where her crew scuttled the ship.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Avalanche Press Gold Club Golden Journal Supplements
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Second Great War at Sea: Tropic of Capricorn
Second Great War at Sea: Tropical Storm

boardgame.name: The Thing: Alien Miniatures Set
boardgame.description:
The Thing – The Boardgame is an intense game experience for 1-8 players based on the 1982 cult movie directed by John Carpenter. It is a game that mixes different mechanics to create an experience that is as faithful as possible to that of the original movie.

The Thing: Alien miniatures expansion contains a set of four highly detailed Alien miniatures, to use in place of the Alien standees you can find into the base game box.

These miniatures represent the 4 stages of evolution of The Thing, with some iconic shapes seen in the movie, such as the Spider-Head or the Norris-Thing.

Using these Alien miniatures in place of Alien standees enriches the game giving it a more scenic aspect and a stronger impact to the gameplay.

boardgame.name: Second World War at Sea: Plan Z – Fleet Air Arm
boardgame.description:
Golden Journal No. 45: Fleet Air Arm is a Plan Z variant, built around the East of Suez sheet. You get an embiggened version of the usual book plus this time 210 die-cut pieces instead of the usual 20 to 40. That is a lot of ships, including scads of Royal Navy light and escort carriers and of course the airplanes to fly off of them and some escorting cruisers and destroyers and suchlike.

For the Journal, we’ll have a set of Plan Z scenarios that give the Brits lots of flight decks and the planes for them, and go with an oversized book.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Avalanche Press Gold Club Golden Journal Supplements
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Second World War at Sea: Plan Z

boardgame.name: Infantry Attacks: Fall of Empires – Imperial & Royal Panzers
boardgame.description:
In 1911, Lt. Gunther Burstyn, an engineer officer of the Imperial Austrian Landwehr who rejected umlauts, presented plans for a Motorgeschütz, in effect a small tank. His vehicle included caterpillar tracks and a revolving turret with a 37mm gun, and looked very modern for its time. The War Ministry declined to accept it, but we’re not limited by such thinking.

Imperial & Royal Panzers is a variant for Infantry Attacks: Fall of Empires, with the Burstyn Motorgeschütz and some other early attempts at armored vehicles like the Austro-Daimler armored car. But most of all, it gives you Austro-Hungarian tanks. In 1914.

It comes with 24 new die-cut, silky-smooth playing pieces. You also get a set of scenarios to turn these proto-panzers loose against the Russians (who do have those 76.2mm field guns, so this it’s no walkover).

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Avalanche Press Gold Club Golden Journal Supplements

boardgame.name: Neuroshima Hex! 3.0: Futboliści
boardgame.description:
During the Polish Open Championship, which took place during Portalcon (22nd January 2022), you could win the brand new Footballers mini-add-on, which contains three unique tiles.

Before the start of the game, each player may place uncovered Futbolist tiles next to their army tile stack*. Each player may place a maximum of: 1 Linebacker, 1 Defender, and 1 Attacker. If, during the game, all 3 tiles a player draws are Instant Action tiles, he may use the Player Substitution rule. If he chooses to do so, he discards one of his drawn tiles and takes 1 of any of his Football Player tiles (placed next to the pile) in its place. He then continues his turn. During the course of the game, a player may make as many Player Substitutions as he has Football Player tiles. If a Football Player tile is removed from the board, it goes to the discard pile of the player who placed it on the board. If more than one player uses Futbolists during a game, each player marks the Futbolist he plays with a spare HQ damage token.
You can still use the Unlucky Draw rule when playing with Futbolists.


Note: You cannot use Futbolists while playing Factions: Dancer, Mephisto, Death Breath.



Przed rozpoczęciem rozgrywki, każdy gracz może umieścić odkryte żetony Futbolistów obok stosu żetonów swojej Frakcji*. Każdy gracz może umieścić maksymalnie: 1 Liniowego, 1 Obrońcę i 1 Atakującego. Jeżeli podczas rozgrywki wszystkie 3 żetony, które dociągnie gracz, będą żetonami Natychmiastowymi, może skorzystać z zasady Podmiany Zawodnika. Jeżeli się na nią zdecyduje, odrzuca jeden z dobranych żetonów, a w jego miejsce bierze 1 dowolny ze swoich żetonów Futbolistów (umieszczony obok stosu). Następnie kontynuuje swoją turę. W trakcie gry, gracz może dokonać tyle Podmian Zawodników, ile żetonów Futbolistów posiada. Jeżeli żeton Futbolisty zostaje usunięty z planszy, trafia na stos odrzuconych żetonów tego gracza, który wcześniej go na tej planszy umieścił. Jeżeli więcej niż jeden gracz korzysta z Futbolistów w czasie rozgrywki, każdy oznacza Futbolistę, którego zagrywa, zapasowym znacznikiem Wytrzymałości Sztabu.
Grając z Futbolistami wciąż można korzystać z zasady Pechowego Dociągu.


Uwaga: Nie można korzystać z Futbolistów podczas gry Frakcjami: Dancer, Mephisto, Death Breath.

boardgame.name: Das Sturmgeheul von Shiyadur
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

Star bearers, that's what those elves are called who wore the star-shaped mark on their shoulder that made them the chosen ones for higher tasks. According to the legends, they once guided the fate of the fenvar, the high elves, until the armies of the dhaza, the nameless Unlight, put an end to their empire.

In the vastness of Bornland and Nivesenland, ruins still bear witness to past battles. Mysteries thousands of years old are hidden here in dense forests, under snow and in the endless steppe. This is where the ancient light elf Niamh retreated, where the high elves once built bulwarks against the armies of the Nameless One and fought fierce battles against them. The legacies of these wars are tainted earth and suffering, which still affects here today. The Starbearer Amalaia's Soul Song is also closely interwoven with the fateful battle of the High Elves in what is now Deadmoor, and so the heroes' path leads them here.

In the fourth adventure of the Star Bearer campaign, the Nivesian steppes and the Bornland are the destination of the Bahalyr and her crew. In legendary places like the Silvanden Fae'den Karen and the Deadmoor, they become deeply involved in the events surrounding Amalaia's death.

A TDE group adventure for 3-6 heroes

Genre: Travel adventure, dream journey
Prerequisites: Will and ability to stand up to the Nameless One; an urge to explore and curiosity.
Location: Niamh's Silvanden Fae'den Karen, Deadmoor with Fortress Shiyadur
Time: Spring-Summer 1041 BF
Complexity (Player/Master): medium / high
Experience of the heroes: masterly

Important Skills:
Combat talents 4 of 4
Crafting talents 2 of 4
Nature talents 2 of 4
Living History 2 of 4

All you need to play is the Black Eye Rulebook and the Aventurian Almanac. All other information for experiencing the adventure such as value boxes, maps and plans, and handouts are included in the volume. It is assumed that the adventures Star Bearer I-III have been played before.


Klappentext

Sternenträger, so werden jene Elfen genannt, die das sternförmige Mal an ihrer Schulter trugen, das sie zu Auserwählten für höhere Aufgaben machte. Einst lenkten sie den Legenden nach die Geschicke der fenvar, der Hochelfen, bis die Armeen des dhaza, des namenlosen Unlichts, ihrem Reich ein Ende machten.

In den Weiten des Bornlandes und Nivesenlandes künden noch heute Ruinen von vergangenen Schlachten. Jahrtausendealte Mysterien verbergen sich hier in dichten Wäldern, unter Schnee und in der endlosen Steppe. Hierhin hat sich die uralte Lichtelfe Niamh zurückgezogen, hier errichteten die Hochelfen einst Bollwerke gegen die Heere des Namenlosen und fochten erbitterte Schlachten gegen sie. Die Hinterlassenschaften dieser Kriege sind verdorbene Erde und Leid, das bis heute hier wirkt. Auch das Seelenlied der Sternenträgerin Amalaia ist eng verwoben mit der schicksalhaften Schlacht der Hochelfen im heutigen Totenmoor, und so führt der Weg der Helden sie hierher.

Im vierten Abenteuer der Sternenträger-Kampagne sind die nivesischen Steppen und das Bornland Ziel der Bahalyr und ihrer Besatzung. An legendären Orten wie dem Silvanden Fae’den Karen und dem Totenmoor werden sie tief in die Geschehnisse um Amalaias Tod verwickelt.

Ein DSA-Gruppenabenteuer für 3–6 Helden

Genre: Reiseabenteuer, Traumreise
Voraussetzungen: Wille und Fähigkeit, dem Namenlosen die Stirn zu bieten; Forscherdrang und Neugier
Ort: Niamhs Silvanden Fae’den Karen, Totenmoor mit Feste Shiyadur
Zeit: Frühling–Sommer 1041 BF
Komplexität (Spieler/Meister): mittel / hoch
Erfahrung der Helden: meisterlich

Wichtige Fertigkeiten:
Kampftalente 4 von 4
Handwerkstalente 2 von 4
Naturtalente 2 von 4
Lebendige Geschichte 2 von 4

Zum Spielen benötigt ihr lediglich das Das Schwarze Auge Regelwerk und den Aventurischen Almanach. Alle weiteren Informationen zum Erleben des Abenteuers wie Wertekästen, Karten und Pläne sowie Handouts sind im Band enthalten. Es wird vorausgesetzt, dass die Abenteuer Sternenträger I–III zuvor gespielt wurden.

boardgame.name: Das Tosen über Liretena
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

Star bearers, that's what those elves are called who wore the star-shaped mark on their shoulder that made them the chosen ones for higher tasks. According to the legends, they once guided the fate of the fenvar, the high elves, until the armies of the dhaza, the nameless Unlight, put an end to their empire.
In the wars against the dhaza's henchmen, the high elves not only lost more and more ground and city after city - no, they also lost their ideals and their sense for the balance between life and death. Like no other city, Liretena stands for this loss. According to the legends, it was devoted entirely to Zerzal, the warlike god of death and decay. It was here that weapons for the armies were forged, but above all that flying ships and other tools of war were constructed in large shipyards. This was also the home of the star carrier Amalaia. Traces of this former metropolis can still be found today.

In the fifth adventure of the Star Carrier campaign, the heroes travel with the Bahalyr across the mountains and forests of Transysilia to the city of Zerzal. Along the way, they will meet allies whose fates are closely tied to those of Amalaia and Liretena, but also enemies who would love to get their greedy hands - and claws - on the Bahalyr. Will the heroes be able to fathom the city's secrets?

A TDE group adventure for 3-6 heroes
Genre: travel adventure, city adventure, dream journey
Requirements: Will and ability to stand up to the Nameless One; an urge to explore and curiosity.
Location: Bornland, Vallusa, Transysilia, Dragonstones, Black Sickle, Troll's Neck, Ox Water, Rankaraliretena / Liretena
Time: Early summer 1041 BF
Complexity (player/master): medium / high
Hero experience: masterful to brilliant

Important Skills:
Social talents 3 of 4
Combat talents 3 of 4
Knowledge talents 2 of 4
Crafting talents 2 of 4
Living History 2 of 4

To play, all you need is the Black Eye Rulebook and the Aventurian Almanac, as well as the first four adventures of the Star Bearer campaign published to date. All other information for experiencing the adventure such as value boxes, maps and plans as well as handouts are included in the volume.


Klappentext

Sternenträger, so werden jene Elfen genannt, die das sternförmige Mal an ihrer Schulter trugen, das sie zu Auserwählten für höhere Aufgaben machte. Einst lenkten sie den Legenden nach die Geschicke der fenvar, der Hochelfen, bis die Armeen des dhaza, des namenlosen Unlichts, ihrem Reich ein Ende machten.

In den Kriegen gegen die Handlanger des dhaza verloren die Hochelfen nicht nur immer mehr an Boden und Stadt um Stadt – nein, ihnen kamen auch ihre Ideale und ihr Sinn für das Gleichgewicht zwischen Leben und Tod abhanden. Wie kaum eine zweite Stadt steht Liretena für diesen Verlust. Den Legenden nach verschrieb sie sich ganz Zerzal, dem kriegerischen Gott des Todes und Vergehens. Hier wurden Waffen für die Armeen geschmiedet, vor allem aber in großen Werften Flugschiffe und anderes Kriegswerkzeug konstruiert. Hier war auch die Heimat der Sternenträgerin Amalaia. Noch heute kann man Spuren dieser einstigen Metropole finden.

Im fünften Abenteuer der Sternenträger-Kampagne reisen die Helden mit der Bahalyr über die Berge und Wälder Transysiliens hinweg in die Stadt des Zerzal. Dabei treffen sie auf Verbündete, deren Schicksal eng mit dem Schicksal Amalaias und Liretenas verbunden ist, doch auch auf Feinde, die die Bahalyr nur zu gern in ihre gierigen Finger – und Krallen – kriegen würden. Werden die Helden die Geheimnisse der Stadt ergründen können?

Ein DSA-Gruppenabenteuer für 3–6 Helden
Genre: Reiseabenteuer, Stadtabenteuer, Traumreise
Voraussetzungen: Wille und Fähigkeit, dem Namenlosen die Stirn zu bieten; Forscherdrang und Neugier
Ort: Bornland, Vallusa, Transysilien, Drachensteine, Schwarze Sichel, Trollzacken, Ochsenwasser, Rankaraliretena / Liretena
Zeit: Frühsommer 1041 BF
Komplexität (Spieler/Meister): mittel / hoch
Erfahrung der Helden: meisterlich bis brillant

Wichtige Fertigkeiten:
Gesellschaftstalente 3 von 4
Kampftalente 3 von 4
Wissenstalente 2 von 4
Handwerkstalente 2 von 4
Lebendige Geschichte 2 von 4

Zum Spielen benötigt ihr lediglich das Das Schwarze Auge Regelwerk und den Aventurischen Almanach sowie die ersten vier bisher erschienen Abenteuer der Sternenträger-Kampagne. Alle weiteren Informationen zum Erleben des Abenteuers wie Wertekästen, Karten und Pläne sowie Handouts sind im Band enthalten.

boardgame.name: The Thing: Norwegian Miniatures Set
boardgame.description:
The Thing – Norwegian Outpost is an intense game experience for 4 to 8 players based on the 2011 prequel to the cult movie, expanding The Thing - The Boardgame with a new setting and new rules.

The Thing: Norwegian Miniatures Set includes eight character miniatures and their character sheets, to expand your choice of characters when playing The Thing - The Boardgame, adding to the game the main protagonists of the 2011 movie, such as Sam Carter or Doctor Sander.

It also enhances the experience of playing with the Norwegian Outpost expansion, using these highly detailed character miniatures to replace the character standees you canfind inside the expansion.

The set also includes a new (and scary!) The Thing miniature.

listing.notes: new, in shrink, perfect condition

boardgame.name: Spielkartenset Schätze & Kostbarkeiten 5
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

The eternal jungle reveals the remains of a hapless questador, and some of her possessions still seem usable. The burglar has overcome the ingenious traps of the Al'Anfan grandee and cracked his dwarven safe, or the explorer intrepidly penetrates the taboo zone of the Utulus tribe and finds an ancient treasure chest. On any game night, your group of heroes may unplannedly come across precious items. This treasure map set allows you to deal with such situations spontaneously and without headaches. Of course, you can also use it when preparing an adventure for fixed treasures to make your work easier.

On 53 cards you will find large and small treasures especially for the south of Aventuria: from the steaming jungles of Meridiana to the mighty Rain Mountains to the squalid alleys and pompous palaces of colonial ports and mighty metropolises.


Klappentext

Der ewige Dschungel gibt die Überreste einer glücklosen Questadorin preis und einige ihrer Besitztümer scheinen noch brauchbar. Der Einbrecher hat die ausgeklügelten Fallen des Al’Anfaner Granden überwunden und dessen zwergischen Tresor geknackt, oder die Entdeckerin dringt unerschrocken in die Tabuzone des Utulustammes vor und findet eine alte Schatztruhe. An jedem Spielabend kann deine Heldengruppe ungeplant an Kostbarkeiten gelangen. Dieses Schatzkarten-Set ermöglicht es dir, derlei Situationen spontan und ohne Kopfzerbrechen zu begegnen. Natürlich kannst du es auch bei der Vorbereitung eines Abenteuers für fest vorgesehene Schätze benutzen, um dir die Arbeit zu erleichtern.

Auf 53 Karten befinden sich große und kleine Schätze speziell für den Süden Aventuriens: von den Dampfenden Dschungeln Meridianas über das gewaltige Regengebirge bis hin zu den verwahrlosten Gassen und pompösen Palästen der Kolonialhäfen und mächtigen Metropolen.

boardgame.name: Reload: Captura la Bandera
Reload: Capture the flag
boardgame.description:
RELOAD: Capture the flag adds the capture the flag team royale game mode to RELOAD as well of funding based stretch goals from the Kickstarter campaign.

Included is an 8-page map Book with maps specially designed for capture the flag.

RELOAD: Capture the flag adds 4 new characters to the game: Diana, Echo, Kaiser, QWERTY & Buzz.

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Spielkartenset Aventurische Transmutarium
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

The set contains all the chimeras and daimonids of the Aventurian Transmutarium, as well as reference cards for all associated rules such as creature traits, combat special skills, spells, and more. Also included are special skills for chimeraologists, overview cards for creating transmutations, focus rules, modifications for created creatures, and helpful alchemics from the volume clearly presented.


Klappentext

Das Set enthält alle Chimären und Daimonide des Aventurischen Transmutariums sowie Referenzkarten für alle zugehörigen Regeln wie Wesenseigenschaften, Kampfsonderfertigkeiten, Zauber und mehr. Außerdem werden Sonderfertigkeiten für Chimärologinnen, Übersichtskarten zur Erschaffung von Transmutationen, Fokusregeln, Modifikationen für erschaffene Kreaturen und hilfreiche Alchimika aus dem Band übersichtlich präsentiert.

boardgame.name: Spielkartenset Pflanzen
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

This set contains all the rules of the plants from the works Aventurisches Herbarium and Aventurisches Herbarium II, as well as all the diseases, addictions, special conditions and directly related creatures caused by them. Thus, 131 plants from all regions and landscape types offer you the full diversity of the Aventurian plant world.


Klappentext

Dieses Set enthält alle Regeln der Pflanzen aus den Werken Aventurisches Herbarium und Aventurisches Herbarium II sowie alle durch sie hervorgerufenen Krankheiten, Süchte, besonderen Zustände und unmittelbar verbundenen Kreaturen. So bieten dir 131 Pflanzen aus allen Regionen und Landschaftstypen die volle Vielfalt der aventurischen Pflanzenwelt.

boardgame.name: Spielkartenset Rezepte
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

This deck of playing cards contains all the rules for recipes from the Rulebook, Aventurian Almanac, Aventurian Magic II, Aventurian Compendium II, Aventurian Herbarium I & II, and the Catacombs & Ruins Master Guide. Specifically, this includes herbal, animal, mineral, and alchemical poisons, herbal remedies, herbal and alchemical intoxicants, preservation recipes, basic recipes, dishes, and elixirs. Also included are the recipe and rules for Mandrake's Homunculus, plant chimeras à la Zurbaran's Plant Tincture, and the new special skill "Alchemical Equivalence Teaching" from the Aventurian Herbarium - with handy overview maps of the affinities of the elements, so that every substitution succeeds!


Klappentext

Dieses Spielkartenset enthält alle Regeln für Rezepte aus Regelwerk, Aventurischer Almanach, Aventurische Magie II, Aventurisches Kompendium II, Aventurisches Herbarium I & II sowie dem Meisterschirmheft zu Katakomben & Ruinen. Konkret umfasst dies pflanzliche, tierische, mineralische und alchimistische Gifte, pflanzliche Hilfsmittel, pflanzliche und alchimistische Rauschmittel, Haltbarmachungsrezepte, Grundrezepte, Gerichte und Elixiere. Außerdem enthalten sind Rezept und Regeln für den Alraunigen Homunculus, Pflanzenchimären à la Zurbarans Pflanzentinktur sowie die neue Sonderfertigkeit „Alchimistische Äquivalenzlehre“ aus dem Aventurischen Herbarium – mit praktischen Übersichtskarten zu den Affinitäten der Elemente, damit jede Substitution gelingt!

boardgame.name: Reload: Team Sponsor Character Pack 1
boardgame.description: This expansion adds alternate versions of all 12 characters found in RELOAD, RELOAD: RUMBLE and RELOAD: CAPTURE THE FLAG. These characters come with all new abilities and skins themed to their team sponsors.

boardgame.name: Monopoly Polska
boardgame.description: Monopoly Polska is a beautiful game designed for everyone who loves to play board games. In this edition based on the original one, the places You visit was changed to the local Poland favorite places. Those were chosen in the national vote! Invest wisely, be a tough negotiator - there is only one winner. Find your own way to get a fortune!

boardgame.name: Reload: Rumble
boardgame.description:
Adds the necessary components to increase the player count to 5 and 6 players. This expansion also introduces several new game mode including 2v2v2 Team Royale and Elimination, as well as the rules to expand the existing game modes for 5 and 6 players.
4 new characters in this expansion: Butcher, Betty Boom, Emmet, and Sora.

73 Tokens
10 Customs Action Dice
4 Character Reference cards
4 Characters miniatures
4 Fame Track sets
2 Action Reference cards
1 Map book
1 Rule book

boardgame.name: Sherlock: Case Connection
boardgame.description:
In Sherlock: Case Connection, you are a detective investigating a crime. Collect proof, make connections between threads, and use this evidence to reconstruct the leads that you are pursuing. Solve the nefarious plots that Sherlock has discovered as you strive to become the world's next greatest detective. Stay determined, and you might even overcome the master himself!

—description from the publisher

Title: Sherlock Case Connection Publisher: Lucky Duck Games Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Spielplanset Die Gestade des Gottwals
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

A battle with multiple participants can be a confusing affair. So that neither player nor game master lose track, we offer you game plans for battle scenes on which you can represent the positions of the combatants with your game markers or miniatures in order to keep battles and other scenes clear. If two markers are close together on the game board, the corresponding combatants are within range for close combat.

In this set you will find game plans for six different battle environments on the shores of the Godwhale, both in Thorwal and in the land of the Gjalsk Barbarians.

The following game plans are included in A3 format:

The Mountain Pass
The Dragon Ship
The Gjalsk village
The Jolskrim (longhouse)
The cliff
The bog
To use the game boards we recommend the Acrylic Marker Set - The Shores of the Godwhale as well as the publications from the Tools of the Master series.


Klappentext

Ein Kampf mit mehreren Beteiligten kann eine unübersichtliche Sache sein. Damit weder Spieler noch Spielleiter den Überblick verlieren, bieten wir euch Spielpläne für Kampfschauplätze, auf denen ihr mit euren Spielmarkern oder Miniaturen die Positionen der Kämpfenden darstellen könnt, um Kämpfe und andere Szenen übersichtlich zu halten. Liegen zwei Marker auf dem Spielplan nah beieinander, befinden sich die entsprechenden Kampfteilnehmer in der Reichweite für den Nahkampf.

In diesem Set findet ihr Spielpläne für sechs verschiedene Kampfumgebungen an den Gestaden des Gottwals, sowohl in Thorwal wie auch im Land der Gjalsker Barbaren.

Folgende Spielpläne sind im Format A3 enthalten:

Der Bergpass
Das Drachenschiff
Das Gjalskerdorf
Das Jolskrim (Langhaus)
Die Klippe
Das Moor
Zur Benutzung der Spielpläne empfehlen wir das Acrylmarker-Set – Die Gestade des Gottwals sowie die Veröffentlichungen aus der Reihe Werkzeuge des Meisters.

boardgame.name: The Shifty Lad & the Curse of the Servant's Coin
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Many years ago the Great Wizard used the Servant’s Coin to acquire a cadre of small, obedient, wooden servants akin to toy dolls. After the Wizard’s demise, the Servant’s Coin also vanished into myth and rumour… until a few years ago, when it reappeared in the possession of a wicked, lazy, and greedy young man bent on revenge.

And now something is brewing in the Tavern at Innsview.

The Shifty Lad & the Curse of the Servant’s Coin is an adventure for the Talisman Adventures Fantasy Roleplaying Game. It is suitable for 2-5 players with characters of 2nd to 4th levels.

boardgame.name: Landkartenset Die Gestade des Gottwals
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

On the sea-swept shores of the Godwhale you will find brave seafarers, magical beast warriors and sinister horrors from the night-black depths and days long past, which make the already rough life in the far north a real challenge.

In keeping with the regional game aid The Shores of the Godwhale, the maps provide a detailed overview of northwestern Aventuria. In addition to a three-part out-game overview map of the geographic regions, the map set includes three atmospheric in-game maps of the Thorval mainland, the Olport Stones, and Gjalskerland, as they might be available to your heroes within the game world.

The out-game maps are laminated to a high quality. In addition to the maps and town plans, the set includes a double-sided A1 poster featuring the cover art from the Regional Game Guide and the Armory of the Shores of the Godwhale.

The map set contains the following maps:

detailed maps of the Thorval mainland, the Olport Stones as well as the Gjalskerland, each A2
general maps of the geographic regions of the shores of the Godwhale and the Thorwalian jarltowns, each A3
In-game maps of the mainland of Thorwal, Olport Stones and Gjalskerland, each A3
City map of the Hjalding city Thorwal, A3
City maps of Enqui, Olport, Prem and Waskir, each A4
City maps of Kendrar and Niellyn, A5 each


Klappentext

An den gischtumtosten Gestaden des Gottwals finden sich tapfere Seefahrer, zaubermächtige Tierkriegerinnen und finstere Schrecken aus nachtschwarzen Tiefen und längst vergangenen Tagen, die das ohnehin raue Leben im hohen Norden zu einer wahren Herausforderung werden lassen.

Passend zur Regionalspielhilfe Die Gestade des Gottwals bieten die Landkarten einen detaillierten Überblick über den Nordwesten Aventuriens. Neben einer dreiteiligen Out-Game-Übersichtskarte der geographischen Regionen enthält das Landkartenset drei stimmungsvolle In-Game-Karten vom Thorwaler Festland, den Olportsteinen und dem Gjalskerland, wie sie euren Helden innerhalb der Spielwelt zur Verfügung stehen könnten.

Die Out-Game-Karten sind hochwertig laminiert. Zusätzlich zu den Karten und Stadtplänen enthält das Set ein doppelseitiges A1-Poster mit den Cover-Motiven der Regionalspielhilfe und der Rüstkammer der Gestade des Gottwals.

Das Landkartenset enthält die folgenden Karten:

detaillierte Karten des Thorwaler Festlands, der Olportsteine sowie des Gjalskerlands, jeweils A2
Übersichtskarten der geographischen Regionen der Gestade des Gottwals und der thorwalschen Jarltümer, jeweils A3
In-Game-Karten des Thorwaler Festlands, der Olportsteine sowie des Gjalskerlands, jeweils A3
Stadtplan der Hjaldingstadt Thorwal, A3
Stadtpläne von Enqui, Olport, Prem und Waskir, jeweils A4
Stadtpläne von Kendrar und Niellyn, jeweils A5

boardgame.name: Bison Dice Game
boardgame.description:
Object: To build and protect a herd of bison. First player to get 100 or more bison, wins.

Playing Pieces: Five spotted dice numbered 2 to 6, with a Bison replacing the "1" spot.

How to Play: The player may roll all five dice up to three times in an attempt to roll a pair of bison. A player must first roll a pair of bison on the same roll before starting to build a herd. Once a player has established a pair of bison, then on each subsequent turn, the player rolls all five dice once and scores each bison as a 10 and all scoring dice at face value.

boardgame.name: Gemeinsame Sache
boardgame.description:
Gemeinsame Sache is a party game for up to eight players.
Each round, a pretty easy question is being shown (for example "A board game?". Now everybody has to secretly write down an answer which fits the most to the current question. You bet on your guess if you think many other players have written it down, too.

Everybody shows its answer the ones who have the same answer as the majority wins and gets point.

boardgame.name: Adventures in Tarnys
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The long lost guide to Tarnys the Grim Fantasy World of Dungeoneer.

This was the world bible for the Dungeoneer expandible card game, and a working document for the card-based roleplaying game. It never got past the "Beta" stage, but by popular demand here is the book in it's latest state.

Dare to enter a realm of fearsome dragons teeming with horrid creatures, armored knights wielding magic swords, mysterious spell casters with mighty magics, and filled with unimaginable treasures for you to discover. Dungeoneer is a fantasy game that uses cards and your imagination to create a world filled with magic, ancient kingdoms, brave heroes, baleful scoundrels, and adventure. You take the role of one of these characters set out to complete quests in order to gain power, glory, and riches.

This book is a little hard to explain. It's part world bible, part pseudo-RPG, part resource book, it has a short comic that gives a taste of the world, and some variant rules. It is designed to work with the Dungeoneer card game, but has a method of recording your deck on the character sheets that doesn't require physical cards.

boardgame.name: Elf: An OSR Class
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The OSR Elf as a unified class for OSR and White Box style games.

The original Elf is a bit of a strange character. On one adventure it is a Fighter on another it is a Magic-User, but it can't be both at the same time. It is awkward and somewhat unwieldy when running an original edition game. How can we make an alternate version that also remains true to the integrity of the system? The core idea is you have a character with good fighting ability and some magic ability.

What if the elf was a full time fighting-man and magic-user? With this in mind we can give the Elf attacks and saves like a fighter, and spells like a magic-user full time. Carefully balanced with the other classes.

Includes full illustrations and a character sheet specifically for the OSR Elf.

boardgame.name: Gong Farmer: An OSR Pre-class
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Gong Farmer, a 0 level class for OSR games.

Real life is often stranger than fiction. The gong farmer, or waste management specialist if you prefer, was a necessary and lucrative career. A perfect start to an adventurer’s life. Suddenly the idea of switching careers to become a cleric doesn’t seem so bad after all. This character class came out of a bit of research on how castles were actually constructed, and a few game sessions playing 0 level characters. It was a lot of fun, and hopefully you’ll have fun with this character too.

boardgame.name: Social Status: An OSR Social System
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Social Status sytem for OSR and White Box style games.

In many societies a person's social status is a significant measurement of their value and influence. In other places it may not matter much at all, but in few places does it have no value. Social currency can be the difference between getting a job, or not. Getting access to an exclusive club, or being thrown out on your ear.

The original fantasy roleplaying game authors nailed it near-perfectly with the standard six abilities, but if there was room for one more it would be some sort of Social Status stat.

Here is Social Status developed and refined into a system that can be added to any OSR game. The information and research is refined into a clear, concise, uncluttered rule set that can add something to just about any fantasy campaign.

boardgame.name: Monopoly Crooked Cash
boardgame.description:
In the Monopoly Crooked Cash game things aren't always as they seem. Someone added fake cash and fake Chance cards! Luckily, Mr. Monopoly is giving players his decoder so they can find the fakes and still make a fortune.

It's a game of hidden reveals, and players get to challenge their opponents for using fakes with accusation coins. But use them wisely! You only get a few coins to play. Includes Monopoly tokens that play up the deceptive theme.

The normal rules and gameplay are streamlined to make the game fairly quick. The game ends when the last street is sold. The player with the most money at the end - real or fake - wins.

boardgame.name: Forgotten Realms Poster Book
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Teleport yourself to the Forgotten Realms of Dungeons & Dragons with these licensed art posters!


HIGH QUALITY POSTERS: Gorgeous 8x10-inch full-color posters featuring 12 cityscapes from the Forgotten Realms
READY TO HANG: Easy removable sheets come ready to hang in your home, office, or anywhere
OFFICIALLY LICENSED: An authentic Dungeons & Dragons product

boardgame.name: Welcome to Tikor
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Explore a world never before seen… where deities and spirits are as real as the nature that surrounds us, and technology and magic exist together. Where most of the faces are dark, yet aren’t constrained to one corner of the globe. Let your imagination run wild, in the beautiful and exhilarating world of Tikor.
...
Explorers can learn about Tikor’s rich lore, landscapes, and advanced equipment and technology, as well as discover various deities and cultures, from the tension between the rival nations of Garuda and Vinyata, to the God-King Hawken’s suspiciously wealthy kingdom, to the monstrous inhabitants of the land known as the Ebon Cascade. For those interested in a diverse book of lore and gorgeous artwork, or those looking to set up a game of their own in a unique world, this book provides the perfect solution.

boardgame.name: Love in the Age of Gongfarmers
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Level 2 Valentines Day Adventure

In this special Valentine’s Day-themed adventure, the PCs play a group of adventurers who face the wrath of an offended deity who has substituted the heart of a young cleric with that of a mechanical bear. To save the cleric, the PCs must face candy heart puzzles, feral fluffees, and other obstacles if they are to keep hope alive and once again know love in the age of gongfarmers.

Originally conceived and performed as “The Lost Heart of Valentinus in the Funnel Love” for Spawn of Cyclops Con 2021 with the winners of the “Love in the Age of Gongfarmers” contest.
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Marvel Champions: Das Kartenspiel – Helden-Pack Nova
Marvel Champions: El Juego de Cartas – Nova Pack de Héroe
Marvel Champions: Il Gioco di Carte – Nova: Pack Eroe
Marvel Champions: Le Jeu De Cartes – Nova
Marvel Champions: The Card Game – Nova Hero Pack
boardgame.description:
A boy, a helmet, and an intergalactic legacy! Sam Alexander isn’t just any teenager; he’s been recruited to the Nova Corps, the universe’s police force. And it’s his job to look after his family and his planet as the high-flying hero Nova!

Fantasy Flight Games is excited to announce the Nova Hero Pack for Marvel Champions: The Card Game!

This cosmic hero rockets into battle in this expansion pack, which introduces Nova as a new playable hero along with his fifteen signature cards. With a pre-built Aggression deck ready to play from the get-go, you’ll be able to tackle your enemies with Nova’s wildcard gameplay from the moment you open the box. With lots of uses for “wild” resources and some powerful, efficient event cards, Nova is a thrilling hero who can contribute to any team!

Also, for the first time, this hero pack comes with a bonus modular encounter set featuring the ridiculously sturdy Armadillo!

—description from the publisher
