boardgame.name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Blacktyde Chosen
boardgame.description:
When people along the coast see the banner of the Kraken, they pray that the Blacktyde Chosen aren’t the ones coming ashore. Not your average raider, the Blacktyde Chosen are kitted out in more sturdy armor, large round shields, and armed with master crafted axes. Their extensive training means they can take charge of a situation, no matter what it is.

The Blacktyde Chosen unit box for the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game gives House Greyjoy players a robust unit for their armies. The unit’s extensive training with their master crafted axes means they can cut apart enemy forces with ease. And their resiliency can see them coming back time and again, even if an opponent once counted them out. Plus, they care nothing for the spoils of war, letting other Greyjoy units collect the loot.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Stark vs Lannister Starter Set

boardgame.name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – House Harlaw Reapers
boardgame.description:
The sigil of House Harlaw is a silver scythe. The House Harlaw Reapers have taken that sigil and turned it into an actual weapon of war. Agricultural scythes make poor combat weapons, but the Reapers have adopted using long-handled axes with equally massive blades. These grisly instruments can mow down men in combat the way a regular scythe can mow down wheat in the field. House Greyjoy is putting them to use, clearing the battlefields of enemies.

The House Harlaw Reapers unit box for the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game gives House Greyjoy players a melee-focused unit for their army. The Reapers wade into battle with their scythes, dealing massive amounts of damage as they go. But as they reap, so too do they sew. Sew chaos among the enemy ranks, anyway. Foes do not like standing against these gruesome soldiers. The set also comes with the Warsworn Unit Attachment that will make taking out enemy ranks and units even more rewarding.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Stark vs Lannister Starter Set

boardgame.name: Rot, Pox, and Worm (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Wretched things dwell in damp and dark places. Sometimes they are too small to even see! Rot, Pox, and Worm for 5e includes 29 all new diseases to inconvenience adventurers or to bring ruinous plot hooks to your campaign. They are designed to run the gamut of sicknesses and mechanical impacts on characters to enrich the struggles and triumphs of you characters, ranging from mundane, to dangerous, to outright deadly if left to fester.

boardgame.name: Das Heldenbrevier der Sonnenküste
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

The famous law enforcer Zamperi is dead. When the body of the famous bloodhound, who over the years has delivered countless criminals to justice, is found in Drôl, the outlaw Griffone Tarsis sees himself as the victim of an intrigue: someone wants to frame him for the murder. Together with the busy Aves devotee Isendrëa of Teremon, he begins to investigate on his own. The two investigators not only have to deal with Zamperi's former student, the merciless law enforcer Lucara von Kelb, but also discover that the intrigue they have unwittingly become involved in is spreading ever wider. The search for the truth leads the two to the Cyclops Islands and finally to the eerie Loch Harodrôl. The journey is not lacking in danger: amorous trysts, secret duels and rogue bandits are Griffone's specialty, after all.


Klappentext

Der berühmte Rechtswahrer Zamperi ist tot. Als die Leiche des bekannten Bluthundes, der im Laufe der Jahre zahllose Verbrecher an die Justiz überantwortet hat, in Drôl aufgefunden wird, sieht sich der Geächtete Griffone Tarsis als Opfer einer Intrige: Jemand will ihm den Mord anhängen. Gemeinsam mit der umtriebigen Avesgeweihten Isendrëa von Teremon beginnt er auf eigene Faust Nachforschungen anzustellen. Die beiden Ermittler müssen sich dabei nicht nur mit Zamperis ehemaliger Schülerin, der gnadenlosen Rechtswahrerin Lucara von Kelb, auseinandersetzen, sondern stellen fest, dass die Intrige, in die sie unversehens geraten sind, immer größere Kreise zieht. Die Suche nach der Wahrheit führt die beiden auf die Zyklopeninseln und schließlich zum unheimlichen Loch Harodrôl. An Gefahren mangelt es der Reise nicht: verliebte Stelldicheins, geheime Duelle und schurkische Banditen sind schließlich Griffones Spezialität.

boardgame.name: Mathemagical World
boardgame.description:
Mathemagical World is an exciting math board game for kids ages 5+ (but can be used by kids across all ages). It takes just seconds to master and can be played from minutes to hours! The best part of our game is that children will not even realize they are learning math as they get immersed in our beautiful world filled with 8 unique islands: Desert Island, Dinosaur Island, Pirate Island, Zombie Island, Unicorn Island, Ice Island, Dragon Island, and Ninja Island!

Practice & Play: Addition and subtraction; Double and half concepts; Includes options for speed and difficulty; Includes options to count use numbered dice or dice with pips

Players take turns rolling the numbered dice with operation die to create a math equation. Solve the equation by adding or subtracting and move the number of spaces to match the answer. Watch out for "Special Spaces" which make the game exciting and fun for the kids!

You can also customize the difficulty:
-The green dice are numbered 1-6 and used for the easiest mode. You will be doing adding within 12 and subtraction within 6.
-The hardest mode uses the red dice which are numbered 1-10. You will be doing addition within 20 and subtraction within 10.

First player to reach the finish line wins.

boardgame.name: Draconiter-Vademecum
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

"Our task is to gather knowledge, evaluate it, and disseminate what is currently correct."
Erechthon, Abbot Primate of the Draconites, 1032 BF

The Draconites are a young order of the Church of Hesinde, open to other members as well as consecrated. They are dedicated to the collection, evaluation, and dissemination of knowledge and punish offenses against the commandments of the goddess Hesinde. What are the rules? What is considered sacrilege? Which knowledge is spread and how?

The Draconiter Vademecum answers these and many other questions. It explains the structure of the order, what training aspirants undergo and what tasks its members perform. It describes the order's shelters and branches and explains the cooperation with the Church of the All Wise and other institutions. The short but eventful history of the order is described as well as important persons and artifacts of the community.

The vademecum is rounded off with suggestions for the formation of a Draconite. Prayers and chants illustrate possibilities of representation at the gaming table or in LARP.


Klappentext

»Unsere Aufgabe ist, Wissen zu sammeln, zu bewerten und das gegenwärtig Richtige zu verbreiten.«
Erechthon, Abtprimas der Draconiter, 1032 BF

Die Draconiter sind ein junger Orden der Hesindekirche, der neben Geweihten auch anderen Mitgliedern offensteht. Sie haben sich der Sammlung, Bewertung und dem Verbreiten von Wissen verschrieben und ahnden Frevel an den Geboten der Göttin Hesinde. Welche Regeln gelten dabei? Was gilt als Frevel? Welches Wissen wird verbreitet und wie?

Auf diese und viele weitere Fragen gibt das Draconiter-Vademecum Antworten. Es erklärt den Aufbau des Ordens, welche Ausbildung Anwärter durchlaufen und welche Aufgaben seine Mitglieder verrichten. Es werden Horte und Niederlassungen des Ordens beschrieben und die Zusammenarbeit mit der Kirche der Allweisen und anderen Institutionen erklärt. Die kurze, aber wechselhafte Geschichte des Ordens wird ebenso geschildert wie wichtige Personen und Artefakte der Gemeinschaft.

Abgerundet wird das Vademecum mit Anregungen für die Ausgestaltung eines Draconiters. Gebete und Gesänge veranschaulichen Möglichkeiten der Darstellung am Spieltisch oder im LARP.

boardgame.name: Glaube, Macht & Heldenmut: Die Sonnenküste
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

Whether a tradition-conscious Hylail sea warrior or a determined Harodian law-keeper, whether a travel-loving Aves devotee from Teremon or a curious member of the Draconite order from Thegûn - the Suncoast is home to an incalculable variety of heroes. Ships from a wide variety of lands dock in the ports of Magna Thalassea, and when they return home, the heroic daughters and sons of the southern Horas Empire also carry adventures across the continent, facing them with faith, might, and valor.

This focus rule supplement introduces you to talent, combat, spell, and liturgy styles, as well as matching Advanced Special Skills for the profession packs from the DSA5 regional game guide The Suncoast.

To use these supplementary rules, you will need the Black Eye Rulebook, the Aventurian Almanac, and The Suncoast - The Savage South & Cyclops Islands.


Klappentext

Ob traditionsbewusster Hylailer Seekrieger oder entschlossene harodische Rechtswahrerin, ob reiselustige Avesgeweihte aus Teremon oder neugieriges Ordensmitglied der Draconiter aus Thegûn – die Sonnenküste ist Heimat einer unüberschaubaren Vielfalt von Helden. Schiffe aus unterschiedlichsten Ländern legen in den Häfen der Magna Thalassea an, und wenn sie nach Hause zurückkehren, tragen sie auch die heldenhaften Töchter und Söhne des südlichen Horasreiches Abenteuern auf dem ganzen Kontinent entgegen, denen sie sich mit Glaube, Macht und Heldenmut stellen.

In dieser Fokusregelergänzung werden dir Talent-, Kampf-, Zauber- und Liturgiestile sowie passende Erweiterte Sonderfertigkeiten für die Professionspakete aus der DSA5-Regionalspielhilfe Die Sonnenküste vorgestellt.

Zur Nutzung dieser Ergänzungsregeln benötigst du das Das Schwarze Auge Regelwerk, den Aventurischen Almanach sowie Die Sonnenküste – Der Wilde Süden & die Zyklopeninseln.

boardgame.name: Labyrinth der Intrigen
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

Odenius, the legendary king of the Cyclops Islands, is well known on the Sun Coast. To this day, scholars and researchers search for his scattered legacies, for numerous myths entwine around his fantastic constructs. So it is not surprising that crowds of visitors flock to the capital of Rethis to attend the memorial days of the so-called tinkerer. But shortly after an old puzzle box from one of the master's workshops turns up, disaster befalls the celebration. Who is behind it and what dark secret has the former sea king hidden here? A race against time begins as sinister forces extend their claws to plunge the Suncoast into chaos. Brave warriors are needed to piece together the pieces of the mosaic and bring to light the events of forgotten days.

Walk in the paths of genius and follow the traces of the past to save the future of the archipelago. The gaze of the gods is upon you. Be careful, for the competition is skilled and treachery lurks all around. Sharpen your wits and your sabers, for you will need both to prevail in the labyrinth of intrigue.

A TDE group adventure for 3-6 inquisitive and battle-hardened heroes.
Genre: travel and mystery adventure, quest quest
Prerequisites: Loyalty to House Thaliyin, curiosity and interest in ancient mysteries and riddles.
Location: Southern Horas Kingdom, Margraviate of Chababia, County of Thegûn, Cyclopean Islands
Time: Rahja 1044 BF
Complexity (player/master): medium/medium
Experience of heroes: competent to masterful

Requirements:
Knowledge talents 3 of 4
Combat 3 of 4
Social talents 2 of 4
Living History 3 of 4

To play, you will only need the Black Eye Rulebook, the Aventurian Almanac, and the Suncoast Game Aid. For details such as city maps, descriptions of locations and information on individual master characters, please refer to the aforementioned game aid; all other information is contained in this volume.


Klappentext

Odenius, der legendäre König der Zyklopeninseln, ist an der Sonnenküste wohlbekannt. Bis heute suchen Gelehrte und Forscher nach seinen verstreuten Hinterlassenschaften, denn zahlreiche Mythen ranken sich um seine phantastischen Konstrukte. So ist es nicht verwunderlich, dass scharenweise Besucher in die Hauptstadt Rethis strömen, um den Gedenktagen des sogenannten Tüftlers beizuwohnen. Doch kurz nachdem ein alter Rätselkasten aus einer Werkstatt des Meisters auftaucht, bricht Unheil über die Feier herein. Wer steckt dahinter und welches dunkle Geheimnis hat der einstige Seekönig hier verborgen? Ein Wettlauf gegen die Zeit beginnt, während finstere Mächte ihre Klauen ausstrecken, um die Sonnenküste ins Chaos zu stürzen. Es sind tapfere Streiter nötig, um die Mosaiksteine zusammensetzen und die Geschehnisse vergessener Tage ans Licht zu bringen.

Wandelt auf den Pfaden des Genius und folgt den Spuren der Vergangenheit, um die Zukunft des Archipels zu retten. Der Blick der Götter ruht auf euch. Seid vorsichtig, denn die Konkurrenz ist geschickt und Verrat lauert rundherum. Schärft euren Verstand und die Säbel, denn ihr benötigt beides, um im Labyrinth der Intrigen zu bestehen.

Ein DSA-Gruppenabenteuer für 3–6 wissbegierige und kampferprobte Helden
Genre: Reise- und Mysterienabenteuer, Suchqueste
Voraussetzungen: Treue gegenüber dem Haus Thaliyin, Neugier und Interesse an alten Mysterien und Rätseln
Ort: südliches Horasreich, Markgrafschaft Chababien, Grafschaft Thegûn, Zyklopeninseln
Zeit: Rahja 1044 BF
Komplexität (Spieler/Meister): mittel/mittel
Erfahrung der Helden: kompetent bis meisterlich

Anforderungen:
Wissenstalente 3 von 4
Kampf 3 von 4
Gesellschaftstalente 2 von 4
Lebendige Geschichte 3 von 4

Zum Spielen benötigt ihr lediglich das Das Schwarze Auge Regelwerk, den Aventurischen Almanach sowie die Spielhilfe Die Sonnenküste. Für Details wie Stadtkarten, Beschreibungen von Orten und Informationen zu einzelnen Meisterpersonen wird auf die genannte Spielhilfe verwiesen, alle weiteren Informationen sind in diesem Band enthalten.

boardgame.name: Glass Road: Upgrade Promo Pack
boardgame.description:
This promo pack includes 5 Building Tiles & The Harlequin card that adds to the solo experience.

Note: If you have the Capstone Games edition of Glass Road, these promos are included in your copy of the game.

The 5 Building Tiles include:

Christmas Market
Stockade
Guest House
Oktoberfest
Rebuild

listing.notes:
Brand new.
Buyer pays for shipping from 70003. All orders over $149 receive a $10 shipping discount.
Shipping is $4 anywhere in the continental United States!

boardgame.name: Landkartenset Die Sonnenküste
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

The map set contains the following maps:

- detailed map of the Savage South and the Cyclops Islands, each A2
- general maps of the geographical regions and political divisions of the Sun Coast, A3 each
- in-game map of the Suncoast in A2
- City maps of Neetha and Drôl, A4 each
- City maps of Morbal, Rethis, Teremon and Thegûn, A5 each
- Map of a typical labyrinth in the Wild South or on the Cyclops Islands in A4


Klappentext

Das Landkartenset enthält die folgenden Karten:

- detaillierte Karte des Wilden Südens und der Zyklopeninseln, jeweils A2
- Übersichtskarten der geographischen Regionen und der politischen Einteilung der Sonnenküste, jeweils A3
- In-Game-Karte der Sonnenküste in A2
- Stadtpläne von Neetha und Drôl, jeweils A4
- Stadtpläne von Morbal, Rethis, Teremon und Thegûn, jeweils A5
- Karte eines typischen Labyrinths im Wilden Süden oder auf den Zyklopeninseln in A4

boardgame.name: Meisterschirmset - Purpurschein & Heldensagen
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

The anthology is part of the Sunshine Coast crowdfunding and brings together the various "master rewards" unlocked via bonus objectives. These include:

- Crowdfunding cover art as an insert for the Universal Player's Guide.
- "Cyclops Eye" entry-level adventure from the "Off to Adventure!" series.
- Kalias' Labyrinth
- Purple Shine & Heroic Saga supplement with six adventure sketches ("Blood Topaz in Thegûn", "The Ship on the Mountain", "The Murder Night of Morbal", "The Beast of Ancient Time", "Pushed to the Edge", "The Sword of Skebos"), the Saga of Geron the One-Handed ("In Geron's Footsteps" I-VI), and the description of the headquarters of the Hesinde Order of the Draconites: the Octagon
- a special edition of the Aventurian Messenger as "Neethan News
- five hero documents each with their own design for the Wild South and the Cyclopean Islands


Klappentext

Die Anthologie ist Teil des Crowdfundings zur Sonnenküste und vereint die verschiedenen "Meister-Prämien", die über Bonusziele freigeschaltet wurden. Dazu gehören:

- Crowdfunding-Cover als Einleger für den Universal-Spielleiterschirm
- Einstiegsabenteuer "Zyklopenauge" aus der Reihe "Auf ins Abenteuer!"
- Kalias' Labyrinth
- Beiheft Purpurschein & Heldensagen mit sechs Abenteuerskizzen ("Blut-Topase in Thegûn", "Das Schiff auf dem Berg", "Die Mordnacht von Morbal", "Die Bestie aus uralter Zeit", "Auf die Spitze getrieben", "Das Schwert von Skebos"), der Sage von Geron dem Einhändigen ("Auf Gerons Spuren" I-VI), und der Beschreibung des Hauptsitz des Hesinde-Ordens der Draconiter: dem Oktogon
- eine Spezialausgabe des Aventurischen Boten als "Neethaner Nachrichten"
- je fünf Heldendokumente mit eigenem Design für den Wilden Süden und die Zyklopeninseln

boardgame.name: Rüstkammer der Sonnenküste
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

From the cloud-crowned High Eternals to the ever-wet swamps of Harodia, from the dusty, remote hinterlands of Chababia to the pastures of the Cyclopean Isles hemmed in by rocky bluffs, the Suncoast is perhaps the most geographically, culturally, and commercially diverse region of the entire Aventurian west coast.

Although part of the Restored Empire of Horas, the Wild South and the Cyclopean Isles have retained their very own cultural identity. Ancient warrior traditions are held in honor here! In addition to the Chababian law enforcers, who hunt criminals with crossbow and waqqif, dressed in a practical brigantina, the students of the High School of Equestrianism of Neetha practice in their riding armor on the longaxe and in fighting high on horseback. No less impressive are the fighters of the Cyclopean Islands in their splendid bonze armor and noble naval armor, showing off their finesse with pailos and parazonium or their skills with the long-handled sarissa. But sinister forces also prevail on the Sun Coast. Whoever gets his hands on a sacrificial dagger can never be quite sure whether it may really only be animal blood ...

The Armory of the Suncoast presents weapons, armor, and other equipment typical of the southern Horas realm. The volume includes a survey of the powerful carmal talismans kept in the region, and introduces some of the dangerous magical artifacts that the emperor dragon Shafir the Magnificent keeps in his hoard. An entire chapter is devoted to the famous forging skills of the Cyclopes, the children of the god Ingerimm, for every Aventurian adventurer dreams of once holding one of the fabled Cyclopean weapons in his hands.

This volume supplements the regional game aid The Suncoast with extensive and generally applicable rules for the special items of the region. Knowledge of the rulebook as well as the Aventurian Almanac is assumed.


KLappentext

Von den wolkengekrönten Hohen Eternen bis zu den immerfeuchten Sümpfen Harodiens, vom staubigen, entlegenen Hinterland Chababiens bis zu den von felsigen Steilküsten eingefassten Weidegründen der Zyklopeninseln – die Sonnenküste ist geographisch, kulturell und kommerziell die vielleicht vielseitigste Region der gesamten aventurischen Westküste.

Obwohl sie zum Wiedererstandenen Reich des Horas gehören, haben sich der Wilde Süden und die Zyklopeninseln ihre ureigene kulturelle Identität bewahrt. Althergebrachte Kriegertraditionen werden hier in Ehre gehalten! Neben den chababischen Rechtswahrern, die sich mit Armbrust und Waqqif, gewandet in eine praktische Brigantina, auf die Jagd nach Verbrechern machen, üben sich die Zöglinge der Hohen Schule der Reiterei zu Neetha in ihren Reiterharnischen an der Langaxt und im Kampf hoch zu Ross. Nicht minder eindrucksvoll sind die Kämpfer der Zyklopeninseln in ihren prächtigen Bonzeharnischen und edlen Seekriegerrüstungen, die ihre Finesse mit Pailos und Parazonium oder ihre Fähigkeiten an der langstieligen Sarissa zur Schau stellen. Doch auch finstere Kräfte walten an der Sonnenküste. Wem ein Opferdolch in die Hände fällt, der kann nie ganz sicher sein, ob ihm wirklich nur tierisches Blut anhaften mag …

Die Rüstkammer der Sonnenküste stellt Waffen, Rüstungen und weitere Ausrüstungsgegenstände vor, die für das südliche Horasreich typisch sind. Der Band enthält eine Übersicht über die mächtigen karmalen Talismane, die in der Region aufbewahrt werden, und stellt einige der gefährlichen magischen Artefakte vor, die der Kaiserdrache Shafir der Prächtige in seinem Hort verwahrt. Der berühmten Schmiedekunst der Zyklopen, der Kinder des Gottes Ingerimm, ist ein gesamtes Kapitel gewidmet, denn jeder aventurische Abenteurer träumt davon, einst eine der sagenumwobenen Zyklopenwaffen in Händen zu halten.

Dieser Band ergänzt die Regionalspielhilfe Die Sonnenküste mit umfangreichen und allgemeingültigen Regeln für die besonderen Gegenstände der Region. Kenntnisse des Regelwerks sowie des Aventurischen Almanachs werden vorausgesetzt.

boardgame.name: Titan Effect Alternative Rules
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Alternative Rules (AR) have been created for those who don’t own the Super Powers Companion. The AR use only the Savage Worlds core rules (Deluxe or Adventure Edition). Psychics are divided in four categories, each one with its own Arcane Background (see below). The AR uses the No Power Points setting rule from Savage Worlds Deluxe, but psychics don’t suffer backlash if they roll a 1 on the arcane skill die. Psychics can have access to all the powers available for their respective Arcane Background, without any rank restriction.

boardgame.name: SPEAR Units Reference Guide
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This small reference manual aims to help the Game Master to use the SPEAR’s Tactical units in his campaign.

boardgame.name: Titan Effect Savage Worlds Adventure Edition Conversion Guide
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This guide contains rules conversion for Titan Effect: The Role-playing Game to Savage Worlds Adventure Edition (SWADE).

boardgame.name: Sphärenklang: Die Sonnenküste
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

From the cloud-crowned High Eternals to the ever-wet swamps of Harodia, from the dusty, remote hinterlands of Chababia to the pastures of the Cyclopean Isles hemmed in by rocky bluffs, the Suncoast is perhaps the most geographically, culturally, and commercially diverse region of the entire Aventurian West Coast.
With this audio CD you can bring the sounds of the southern Horas realm to your gaming table. It was conceived by Ralf Kurtsiefer in cooperation with the TDE editorial staff to aurally depict the diverse cultural background of the Sun Coast.

A melting pot of cultures is the so-called Wild South of the Horas Empire, where personal honor and family cohesion shape society and long-established nobility tries to assert itself against the strengthening patriciate. Away from the big cities, the law of the strongest is enforced by law enforcers, who, however, can hardly assert themselves against the numerous predatory gangs of the hinterland. Things are quite different on the Cyclopean Islands, where a stoic and frugal breed of people shares barren cliffs and primeval forests with mystical fairy creatures.

The music on this CD can be used to set the mood for many of the play scenes on the Cyclopean Sea. They were inspired by a wide variety of encounters and experiences typical of the south of the Horas realm, and many of them can be usefully placed in the accompanying regional adventure Labyrinth of Intrigue. The album is also suitable for pure musical enjoyment and as a creativity-enhancing introduction to the multifaceted environment of the Sun Coast.


Klappentext

Von den wolkengekrönten Hohen Eternen bis zu den immerfeuchten Sümpfen Harodiens, vom staubigen, entlegenen Hinterland Chababiens bis zu den von felsigen Steilküsten eingefassten Weidegründen der Zyklopeninseln - die Sonnenküste ist geographisch, kulturell und kommerziell die vielleicht vielseitigste Region der gesamten aventurischen Westküste.
Mit dieser Audio-CD kannst du die Klänge des südlichen Horasreiches an deinen Spieltisch bringen. Konzipiert wurde sie von Ralf Kurtsiefer in Zusammenarbeit mit der DSA-Redaktion, um den vielfältigen kulturellen Hintergrund der Sonnenküste auditiv abzubilden.

Ein Schmelztiegel der Kulturen ist der sogenannte Wilde Süden des Horasreiches, wo persönliche Ehre und familiärer Zusammenhalt die Gesellschaft prägen und alteingesessener Adel sich gegen das erstarkende Patriziat zu behaupten sucht. Abseits der großen Städte wird das Recht des Stärkeren von Rechtswahrern durchgesetzt, die sich jedoch kaum gegen die zahlreichen räuberischen Banden des Hinterlandes durchsetzen können. Ganz anders geht es auf den Zyklopeninseln zu, wo sich ein stoischer und genügsamer Menschenschlag karge Klippen und urtümliche Wälder mit mystischen Feenwesen teilt.

Mit den Musikstücken auf dieser CD lassen sich viele Spielszenen an der Zyklopensee stimmungsvoll untermalen. Als Inspiration dienten unterschiedlichste Begegnungen und Erlebnisse, wie sie für den Süden des Horasreiches typisch sind, und auch im begleitenden Regionalabenteuer Labyrinth der Intrigen lassen sich viele von ihnen sinnvoll unterbringen. Ebenso eignet sich das Album als reiner Musikgenuss sowie als die Kreativität fördernde Einstimmung auf die facettenreiche Umgebung der Sonnenküste.

boardgame.name: Spielplanset Die Sonnenküste
boardgame.description:
Pubslisher's blurb

A battle with multiple participants can be a confusing affair. So that neither player nor game master lose the overview, we offer you game plans for battle scenes, on which you can represent the positions of the fighters with your game markers or miniatures, in order to keep fights and other scenes clear. If two markers are close together on the game board, the corresponding combatants are within range for close combat.

In this booklet, you'll find game plans for five different combat environments on the Sun Coast, both in the Savage South and on the Cyclops Islands.

The following game plans are included:

The Temple Ruin (A2)
The Hill Country (A3)
The headland (A3)
The Mangroves (A3)
The volcano (A3)
To use the game plans, we recommend the Acrylic Marker Set - The Sun Coast as well as the publications from the Tools of the Master series.


Klappentext

Ein Kampf mit mehreren Beteiligten kann eine unübersichtliche Sache sein. Damit weder Spieler noch Spielleiterin den Überblick verlieren, bieten wir euch Spielpläne für Kampfschauplätze, auf denen ihr mit euren Spielmarkern oder Miniaturen die Positionen der Kämpfenden darstellen könnt, um Kämpfe und andere Szenen übersichtlich zu halten. Liegen zwei Marker auf dem Spielplan nah beieinander, befinden sich die entsprechenden Kampfteilnehmer in der Reichweite für den Nahkampf.

In diesem Heft findet ihr Spielpläne für fünf verschiedene Kampfumgebungen an der Sonnenküste, sowohl im Wilden Süden als auch auf den Zyklopeninseln.

Folgende Spielpläne sind enthalten:

Die Tempelruine (A2)
Das Hügelland (A3)
Die Landzunge (A3)
Die Mangroven (A3)
Der Vulkan (A3)
Zur Benutzung der Spielpläne empfehlen wir das Acrylmarker-Set – Die Sonnenküste sowie die Veröffentlichungen aus der Reihe Werkzeuge des Meisters.

boardgame.name: Die Sonnenküste
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

From the cloud-crowned High Eternals to the ever-wet swamps of Harodia, from the dusty, remote hinterlands of Chababia to the rocky bluffs of the Cyclopean Isles, the Suncoast is perhaps the most geographically, culturally, and commercially diverse region of the entire Aventurian West Coast.

This regional game aid provides you with supplementary background material on the Sun Coast. The south of the Horas realm is characterized by cultural diversity in a Mediterranean idyll. Proud cities rise on the ruins of long-gone civilizations. While the inhabitants of the Wild South are distinguished above all by their strong self-confidence and complex rules of social cohesion, the Cyclopeans are known for their love of philosophy and for the almost stoic calm with which they accept the harsh conditions of the Cyclopean Sea and come to terms with the mysterious fairies residing throughout the archipelago.

Eleven professions appropriate to the region are introduced, including the resolute guardian of the law, the inquisitive consecrate of the Order of the Draconites, or the Cyclopean spellbinder, the Satuduraki, captivating with her melodious flute playing.

Furthermore included are:

a detailed explanation of the social characteristics of the region as well as the life in its villages and towns,
an extensive regional bestiary and herbarium,
a freely locatable labyrinth with a matching adventure scenario,
new weapons and armor, including the traditional Hylail sling, the famous Pailos, and the awe-inspiring Cyclopean bronze armor,
focus rules on traits that give your heroes region-specific flair, as well as a table to inspire or dice your hero background,
new special skills, spells, rituals, liturgies and ceremonies,
a large chapter of mysteries and adventure hangers especially for the game master
and enclosed maps of the region (A3) plus maps of Neetha, Drôl, Rethis, Thegûn, Teremon and Morbal printed in the book!


Klappentext

Von den wolkengekrönten Hohen Eternen bis zu den immerfeuchten Sümpfen Harodiens, vom staubigen, entlegenen Hinterland Chababiens bis zu den von felsigen Steilküsten eingefassten Weidegründen der Zyklopeninseln – die Sonnenküste ist geographisch, kulturell und kommerziell die vielleicht vielseitigste Region der gesamten aventurischen Westküste.

Mit dieser Regionalspielhilfe erhältst du ergänzendes Hintergrundmaterial zur Sonnenküste. Der Süden des Horasreiches zeichnet sich durch kulturelle Vielfalt in einer mediterranen Idylle aus. Stolze Städte erheben sich auf den Ruinen längst vergangener Zivilisationen. Während die Bewohner des Wilden Südens sich vor allem durch ihr ausgeprägtes Selbstbewusstsein und komplexe Regeln des gesellschaftlichen Zusammenhalts auszeichnen, sind die Zyklopäer für ihre Liebe zur Philosophie bekannt und für die fast schon stoische Ruhe, mit der sie die rauen Bedingungen in der Zyklopensee hinnehmen und sich mit den überall auf dem Archipel ansässigen mysteriösen Feen arrangieren.

Elf zur Region passende Professionen werden vorgestellt, darunter der entschlossene Rechtswahrer, der wissbegierige Geweihte vom Orden der Draconiter oder die durch ihr melodiöses Flötenspiel bestechende zyklopäische Zauberbardin, die Satuduraki.

Weiterhin sind enthalten:

eine ausführliche Erläuterung der gesellschaftlichen Eigenheiten in der Region sowie des Lebens in ihren Dörfern und Städten,
ein umfangreiches regionales Bestiarium und Herbarium,
ein frei verortbares Labyrinth mit passendem Abenteuerszenario,
neue Waffen und Rüstungen, darunter die traditionelle Hylailer Schleuder, der berühmte Pailos und der ehrfurchtgebietende zyklopäische Bronzeharnisch,
Fokusregeln zu Wesenszügen, die deinen Helden regionstypisches Flair verleihen sowie eine Tabelle zur Inspiration oder zum Auswürfeln deines Heldenhintergrundes,
neue Sonderfertigkeiten, Zauber, Rituale, Liturgien und Zeremonien,
ein großes Kapitel mit Mysterien und Abenteueraufhängern speziell für die Spielleiterin
und beiliegende Karten der Region (A3) plus im Buch abgedruckte Stadtpläne von Neetha, Drôl, Rethis, Thegûn, Teremon und Morbal!

boardgame.name: Spielkartenset Die Sonnenküste
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

From the cloud-crowned High Eternals to the ever-wet swamps of Harodia, from the dusty, remote hinterlands of Chababia to the rocky bluffs of the Cyclopean Isles, the Suncoast is perhaps the most geographically, culturally, and commercially diverse region of the entire Aventurian West Coast.

This set of 168 cards contains the spells, rituals, liturgies, ceremonies, special skills, traits, equipment, and other useful content from the regional game aid The Suncoast, the region's armory, and the adventure Labyrinth of Intrigue. The cards contain all the relevant information, so you can use them directly in the game as a master.


Klappentext

Von den wolkengekrönten Hohen Eternen bis zu den immerfeuchten Sümpfen Harodiens, vom staubigen, entlegenen Hinterland Chababiens bis zu den von felsigen Steilküsten eingefassten Weidegründen der Zyklopeninseln – die Sonnenküste ist geographisch, kulturell und kommerziell die vielleicht vielseitigste Region der gesamten aventurischen Westküste.

Dieses Set mit 168 Karten enthält die Zauber, Rituale, Liturgien, Zeremonien, Sonderfertigkeiten, Wesenszüge, Ausrüstungsgegenstände und weitere nützliche Inhalte aus der Regionalspielhilfe Die Sonnenküste, der Rüstkammer der Region sowie dem Abenteuer Labyrinth der Intrigen. Auf den Karten befinden sich alle relevanten Informationen, sodass man sie als Meisterin direkt im Spiel nutzen kann.

boardgame.name: Weapon Perks
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Weapons are more than just objects that adventurers carry to stab, slice, or break enemies with. In the proper hands of a master, they can be powerful tools to gain the upper hand against an enemy. A weapon perk is a special skill or technique that can be used with a specific weapon. This allows each weapon to feel unique among all of the options the adventurers have, and hopefully give them their own identity.

boardgame.name: Diseases of Icewind Dale
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This supplement is written by medical students with a love for tabletop roleplaying games. Inspired by a wide array of ailments, and the medieval myths that once surrounded them, we embarked on a mission: to enrich other worlds with fantastic diseases.

boardgame.name: Shattered Omens
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Part 1 of the Scattered Sentiments Trilogy

The Earthmother calls to her druids through the rustling of tree leaves and the whisper of the wind. There is a grand prophecy that needs to be heard; the Great Druid Llyneth Kincaid needs your assistance to acquire a lost relic to make the voice and vision clear.

A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 2 Characters. Optimized for APL 8.

boardgame.name: Forgotten Fealty
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Part 2 of the Scattered Sentiments Trilogy

The Great Prophecy calls you to the Belly of the Leviathan, where an island inhabited by the Black Blood Tribe remains suspended. Whispers carry that a Black Blood Leader, Fflur Hithen, has found an object letting her control the shadow creatures immuring from the gloom; she seeks admiration, and none can resist her lure. Can you?

A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 2 Characters. Optimized for APL 8.

Content Warning: This adventure contains themes of abandonment, grief, and mind control. Player discretion is advised.

boardgame.name: Fallen Wonder
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Part 3 of the Scattered Sentiments Trilogy

Having received an invitation to meet with Earl Orwin Rhys, the adventurers find themselves in Caer Moray to hear a most strange tale. Every few nights an aurora shines over the moors, and Ffolk on the outskirts of the refugee camps begin to wander aimlessly into the soft-lit grasses, a look of wonder and amazement in their eyes. Are you brave enough to solve this perplexing mystery? A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 2 Characters. Optimized for APL 8.

Content Warning. This adventure contains themes of abandonment, mental illness, and mind control. Player discretion is advised.

boardgame.name: Two Hearts Apart
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Your friend is kidnapped on their wedding day. Can you save them?

Strange beings whisked your friend away to an unknown fey realm and you join forces with their fiancé to rescue them. Travel to an otherworldy place where you must use your might, your wits, and your social skills to navigate the wilderness and the challenges of the heart.

A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 2 Characters with a balanced mix of combat, exploration and social interaction/role play opportunities. Optimized for APL 8.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: Old Scores
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

THE END HAS COME!

The adventurers return to Salvation as champions, but old scores remain to be settled. The Oracle of War holds the key to Eberron's future and whoever claims it will become master of their own destiny. It's time for the final reckoning. Optimized for APL 20, this is the conclusion of a quartet of adventures, the Flames of War storyline.

boardgame.name: Four Skulls
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

At each of the corners of our flat planet rests a temple to a fallen god, a protector of the lands between who (by blade, banishment, or benevolence) has failed to protect any longer. Amidst them lies a melting land in peril, a nation of vile rot and a putrid few who revel in the collapse at the expense of the rest. You must make a pilgrimage to each corner temple and offer each god a powerful skull to enact the revival ritual and rescue your world from imminent jeopardy.

Four Skulls is a tabeltop roleplaying game by Adam Vass for 2-5 players and a gamemaster (GM). In this game, you play as Warriors, those brave or foolish enough to traverse the wastes and confront the terrors within in an attempt to resurrect the gods.

Each player needs a character sheet and handful of six-sided dice. Your group also needs a shared sticker sheet (or you can print it off on regular paper and tape words in the rulebook). Make your own sticker sheet if you want, body text is 10pt Open Sans.

boardgame.name: Roguish Archtype: The Highway Man
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bring Ravenloft to your table with this new Roguish Archetype.

In this new supplement for Ravenloft, you are introduced to the Highway Man a mounted rogue who is both dashing and well-armed

In Roguish Archetype: Highway Man, you meet a Rogue who is skilled a rider and an excellent marksman who does everything with style and daring. Highway Man is a perfect addition to any Ravenloft campaign and is perfectly at home in any other gothic style campaign

Inside you will find:

Roguish Archetype: Highway Man
6 new feats with a Ravenloft flavour
12 new magic items for perfectly suit for the Highway Man
2 new weapon types

boardgame.name: Rogues of Ravenloft
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bring Ravenloft to your table with these new Roguish archetypes.

In this new supplement for Ravenloft, you are introduced four new roguish archetypes. The Crypt Raider, the Cutpurse, the Snake Oil Seller, and the Vagabond Performer.

In Champions of Ravenloft: Rogues of Ravenloft, you meet 4 new Rogues who are different from your average thief or assassin, each is high on flavour, designed for maximum roleplay, and most importantly fun to play.

The Crypt Raider is a scholar-warrior who searches for ancient tombs to plunder their treasure and to remove the evil that might dwell inside these lost vaults of the dead.

The Cutpurse works in the crowded cities of the domain of dread robbing or mugging from any who cross their path.

The Snake Oil Seller is a master conman who moves from town to town selling their fake cures and curios. These rogues are the ultimate scam artists.

The Vagabond performer is highly trained acrobat and street performer who steals the riches of the crowds that form to watch the show, put on by these dexterous rogues.

These four new roguish archetypes are perfect additions to any Ravenloft campaign and are perfectly at home in any other gothic style or standard campaign.

Inside you will find:

4 New Roguish Archetype: The Crypt Raider, the Cutpurse, the Snake Oil Seller, and the Vagabond Performer.
10 new feats for the rogue with a Ravenloft flavour

boardgame.name: Oath of the Vampire Slayer
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bring Ravenloft alive with this new Sacred Oath.

In this new supplement for Ravenloft, you are introduced to the Oath of the Vampire Slayer, a paladin who hunts the lord of the undead the vampire.

The Oath of the Vampire Slayer is an excellent addition to any Ravenloft campaign and is perfectly at home in any other gothic style campaign

Inside you will find:

Roguish Archetype: Highway Man
2 new feats with a Ravenloft flavor

boardgame.name: Butterfly
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In playing Butterfly, we explore the history of a singular shared Artist, their relationship with a significant person in their life, the subjective & imperfect memories of time spent together, and the art they make of it.

boardgame.name: Vampire Bloodline: Sorcerous Origin
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bring Ravenloft alive with this new Sorcerous Origin.

In this new supplement for Ravenloft, you are introduced to the Sorcerous Origin: Vampire Bloodline, a sorcerer born of the necromantic energy of the vampires’ dark embrace. While you are not undead many of the vampires’ abilities and weakness are awakened in you. Only time will tell if the bloodlust of the vampire overwhelms you.

The Sorcerous Origin: Vampire Bloodline is an excellent addition to any Ravenloft campaign and is perfectly at home in any other gothic style campaign

Inside you will find:

Sorcerous Origin: Vampire Bloodline
3 New magic items

boardgame.name: Treasures of Ravenloft
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The plane of Ravenloft is a place of darkness and terrible evil. Dread lords control their domains with an iron fist forever imprisoned by dark powers as punishment for their evil actions. The light and goodness are stifled in Ravenloft, and only brave heroes can stand against the darkness, but the heroes will need magic of great power if they hope to defeat the Dread Lords. Ancient treasures of magical power lie hidden in ancient tombs and decaying towers, and it takes is a team of brave adventurers to go and claim the Treasures of Ravenloft

Treasure of Ravenloft is a supplement made to bring more options to the Ravenloft campaign setting and the Curse of Strahd adventure Path

In this supplement, you will find 41 New Ravenloft-themed Magic items and 20 Gothic Horror Magical Trinkets

9 Suits of magic armor and shields
17 Magical weapons
15 Wondrous items
20 New Magical Trinkets
5 New Spells

boardgame.name: Trinkets of Gothic London
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Trinkets of Gothic London for Ravenloft Gothic Earth

This supplement introduces 50 new trinkets that you may find in Gothic Earth London.

The trinkets presented in this supplement are inspirited by the general culture of London and civilization that created all with a little gothic horror thrown in and will bring an additional layer of depth to any Gothic Earth campaign. Many of the curiosities are designed as plot devices to inspire side quests and one-shot adventures in Ravenloft Gothic Earth.

This supplement is the fouth in a series of Trinket supplements for Ravenloft and Ravenloft Gothic Earth all with an eye towards bringing your campaign to life

boardgame.name: Trinkets & Magical Curiosities of the Domain of Dread Vol. 2
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Trinkets and Magical Curiosities of Ravenloft Vol. 2

This supplement introduces one hundred new trinkets that you may find on the demiplane of Ravenloft.

The trinkets presented in this supplement are inspirited by the gothic horror genre and will bring an additional layer of depth to any Ravenloft or Curse of Strahd campaign. Many of the curiosities are designed as plot devices to inspire side quests and one-shot adventures in Ravenloft.

The Ravenloft is home to many cultures, and the sheer volume of trinkets and curiosities to be found in Ravenloft is massive. This supplement represents the merest fraction of what one can find on the demiplane of dread.

boardgame.name: Otherworldly Patron: The Great Cthulhu
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bring the Eldritch Terror of the Great Old Ones to your table with this new Otherworldly Patron.

In this new supplement for Great Old Ones and Elder Evil series, you are introduced to the Warlocks of the Great Cthulhu.

In Otherworldly Patron: The Great Cthulhu, you meet warlocks who serve the Great Cthulhu a Great Old One of Godlike power. Cthulhu lies in a deathlike dreaming state at the bottom of the ocean on the planet of Gothic Earth. Although Cthulhu dreams he can still reach out across the sea of stars to find mortals he can use to prepare the world for his eventual coming. Cthulhu now waits for the time when the stars are right to open up the gates for the Great Old Ones to drown the world in a tidal wave of chaos and darkness.

For use with the Ravenloft campaign setting and any campaign world where you wish to introduce the Great Cthulhu to your game

What you find inside

Otherworldly Patron: The Great Cthulhu
21 New Eldritch Invocations
16 New spells created with the Great Old Ones in mind

boardgame.name: Deck of Rumours - Call to Adventure
boardgame.description:
(Back of Box)

Immerse your players with ease!

Each Deck of Rumours set contains 50 card theme around a fantasy town noticeboard. Unveil cards at random or use the reference icons on the back of each card to tailor the notices to your world - the choice is up to you!

Call To Adventure

Quests galore! Whether your party seeks glory or money, there are plenty of adventures stuffed inside this little box!

boardgame.name: Warlock Patron: The Bornless One
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bring the Outer Planes to your table with this new Warlock Patron.

In this new supplement for Outer Planes adventures, you are introduced to the Warlock Patron the Bornless One, who is a combination of psychic and eldritch magic with a dash wise sage thrown in.

In Warlock Patron the Bornless One, you meet a Warlock who is a skilled spellcaster and seeker of the mysteries of the multiverse. Tasked by the immortal being the Bornless one to bring balance to the multiverse you are at home in adventuring parties that can be good, evil, or neutral. This warlock patron is a perfect addition to any Outer Planes campaign but is perfectly at home in any other campaign setting

Inside you will find:

• Warlock Patron: the Bornless One

• 6 new eldritch invocation

• 10 new spells to showcase the style of the Bornless One

boardgame.name: Sacred Oath: Oath of the Kinslayer
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bring the Underdark to your table with this new Sacred Oath.

In this new supplement for Underdark campaigns, you are introduced to the Sacred Oath: Oath of Kinslayer, a drow paladin who has vowed an oath of vengeance against all surface dwelling elves and drow who have turned their backs on Lolth.

In Sacred Oath: Oath of Kinslayer, you meet a drow paladin who is blessed by the spider queen with all manner of offensive and defensive abilities designed to bring the fight to the surface elves. This sacred oath is perfect for all drow adventuring groups or for any Underdark campaign but is perfectly at home in any other surface dwelling campaign settings

Inside you will find:

• Sacred Oath: Oath of the Kinslayer

• 5 new spells to showcase the power of the drow

boardgame.name: Races of Ravnica: Children of Rakdos
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bring Ravnica to your table with these two new player races

In this new supplement for Ravnica, you are introduced to the Half-demon and Rakdos Imp

In Children of Rakdos, you meet the Half-demon whose Abyssal ancestry brings them one step closer to Rakdos himself. Many of the important leaders of the Guild of Rakdos are or were half-demons. The Rakdos Imps are chaos in small packages. When life in the Rakdos guild is all about making a spectacle and public showmanship it’s hard to be noticed when you’re so little. The Rakdos Imp get seen by scaring unwitting spectators and sowing chaos and mayhem in the crowds during guild performances.

Inside you will find:

Half-demon race
Rakdos Imp

boardgame.name: Champions of the Great Old Ones: Oath of Madness
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bring the Eldritch Terror of the Great Old Ones to your table with this new Sacred Oath.

In this new supplement for Great Old Ones and Elder Evil series, you are introduced to the paladins of the Great Old Ones.

In Oath of Madness, you meet paladins who are corrupted in body and soul by the power of the Great Old Ones and have taken an oath to spread the maddening wisdom of Eldritch beings like Great Cthulhu to the world and when the stars are right to open up the gates for the Great Old Ones to drown the world in a tidal wave of chaos and darkness.

What you find inside

The Sacred Oath: Oath of Madness
5 New spells created with the Great Old Ones in mind

boardgame.name: Horonial's Guide to the Blood Wars Vol. 1: Weapons of Spite and Malice
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Horonial’s Guide to the Blood Wars is an ongoing series that details the great war between the demons of the abyss and the devils of the nine hells

The first volume in this series Weapons of Spite and Malice catalogues the magical weapons used in the blood war and offers ideas on how to bring these fiendish tools of destruction into any campaign

In this book, you will find:

24 fiendish magical weapons

2 Sentient magic swords

4 new weapon types

4 New Spells

9 Plot hooks for introducing the blood wars to your campaign

boardgame.name: Horonial's Guide to the Blood Wars Vol. 2: Armor of Rage and Damnation
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Horonial’s Guide to the Blood Wars is an ongoing series that details the great war between the demons of the abyss and the devils of the nine hells.

The first volume in this series Armor of Rage and Damnation catalogues the magical armour and shields used in the blood war and offers ideas on how to bring these fiendish tools of destruction into any campaign

In this book, you will find:

15 fiendish magical suits of armour
3 Shields
5 Helms
24 New Blood Wars Oriented Spells

boardgame.name: Arcane Tradition: Diabolist
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bring the Blood Wars to your table with this new Arcane Tradition.

In this new supplement for the Blood Wars, you are introduced to the diabolist, a wizard who has sold their soul to the Devils of the Nine Hells for great power. Able to conjure the fires of the nine hells at whim, the diabolist can lay waste to their enemies with fire and infernal spells. The diabolist seeks one thing power and nothing in this world or planes will stop them.

In Arcane Tradition: Diabolist, you meet wizards who cannot only throw spells but sit back and conjure demons and let them do the dirty work.

What you will find inside

Arcane Tradition: Diabolist
16 New Feats
31 New Spells

boardgame.name: Oath of the Abyss
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bring the Blood Wars to your table with this new Sacred Oath.

In this new supplement for the Blood Wars, you are introduced to the paladins of the Abyss.

In Oath of the Abyss, you meet paladins who cannot only fight but conjure demons to aid them.

What you find inside

The Sacred Oath: Oath of the Abyss
5 New Abyssal spells

boardgame.name: Oath of the Infernal
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bring the Blood Wars to your table with this new Sacred Oath.

In this new supplement for the Blood Wars, you are introduced to the paladins of the Nine Hells.

In Oath of the Infernal, you meet paladins who cannot only fight but conjure devils to aid them. These paladins fight and corrupt with equal ease.

What you find inside

The Sacred Oath: Oath of the Infernal
6 New Infernal spells

boardgame.name: Arcane Tradition: Demonologist
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bring the Blood Wars to your table with this new Arcane Tradition.

In this new supplement for the Blood Wars, you are introduced to the Demonologist a wizard who can summon demons and bind them to their service. The Demonologist has focused their magical studies on demons and how they can be best used for personal gain

In Arcane Tradition: Demonologist, you meet wizards who cannot only throw spells but sit back and conjure demons and let them do the dirty work.

What you find inside

Arcane Tradition: Demonologist
6 New Demonologist spells

boardgame.name: Races of the Blood War: The Imp
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this new supplement for the Blood wars, you have introduced to the Imp

The Imps are lowest on the power structure of the Nine Hells just above the mindless lemures. What Imps don’t make up for in power they do with an enthusiastic desire to serve a great master or evil. Imps are traditionally encountered serving evil wizards or warlocks as their familiars biding their time on the material plane, hoping one day to return to the Hells having done a good enough job to merit being raised in power.

How you choose to play your Imp is up to you but here are a few examples
- As familiar for another hero in your playing group
- You could play an Imp who has no master but has elected to stay on the material plane
- Perhaps an Imp who wants to return to the Blood war in hopes of making a name for themselves and maybe collect a few soul coins along the way

Included in this supplement
- The Imp race
- 5 New racial feats for Imp

boardgame.name: Races of the Blood War: Quasit
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this new supplement for the Blood wars, you have introduced to the Quasit

The Quasit is the lowest demon in the power structure of the Abyss. Quasits spend most of their existence trying to hide from bigger, more powerful demons who like nothing more than eating them or tearing them in two. Quasits one genuine desire is to serve a powerful master and will go out of its way to please its master. The Quasit race of demons is most frequently encountered on the material plane acting a wizards’ familiar. While in the Abyss a lucky Quasit may work a messenger or performing odd jobs for a greater demon. The life of a Quasit usually ends very quickly due to the violent nature of the Abyss, but few do go on to make something of themselves.

How you choose to play your Quasit is up to you but here are a few examples
- As familiar for another hero in your playing group
- You could play a Quasit who has no master but has elected to stay on the material plane
- The Quasit serves another master in the Abyss and in the form a familiar is spying on the heroes.

Included in this supplement
- The Quasit race
- 3 New racial feats for Quasit

boardgame.name: Races of the Blood War: The Bearded Devil
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this new supplement for the Baldurs Gate: Descent into Avernus you have introduced a new playable race the Bearded Devil.

The Bearded Devils are the shocked troop of the Nine Hells in their war with the Demons. Mean spirited and ill-tempered the Bearded Devil is quick to offence and quicker to violence. Some bearded devils defy racial stereotypes and are more neutral in character, all though by their very nature cannot be good. Bearded Devils are a common sight on the plan of Avernus usually as soldiers for the Blood War, but some Bearded Devils act as scouts or messengers for more powerful demons, especially when sending an important message.

The Bearded Devil is the perfect race in more immersive Blood War campaigns and in any outer plane campaign

Included in this supplement

The Bearded Devil race
4 New racial feats for Bearded Devil
1 New Spell

boardgame.name: Warlocks of Avernus
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bring the Blood Wars to your table with these new fiendish warlock patrons

In this latest supplement for the Blood Wars, you are introduced to 5 new warlock patrons. Ranging from the fallen angel Zariel the dark lady of Avernus to Pale Night, the very mother of demons.

Each of these warlocks plays a role in the Blood war, some like the followers of Zariel are on the frontlines of blood war standing shoulder to shoulder with devils and mercenary yugoloths; others like the followers of Pale Night pull the strings of the blood war usually staying out of the direct conflict but whose subtle actions behind the scenes can turn the tide of a battle

What you will find inside

Zariel
Dagon
Pazuzu
Pale Night
Malcanthet
Plus 11 New Eldritch Invocations
New binding marks for followers of fiendish patrons

boardgame.name: Trinkets of Avernus
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Trinkets of Avernus

This supplement introduces one hundred new trinkets that you may find on the 1st layer of Hell Avernus.

The layer of Avernus was once a place of dark beauty a malign paradise in the lower planes, but the Blood war between the Demons and Devils changed all that. Avernus become ground zero for the Blood War, and soon the once beautiful plane of Avernus become a blasted wasteland. Ruins abound on this layer of Hell, and the signs of former civilization are everywhere.

The sheer volume of trinkets and curiosities to be found on Avernus is staggering, and this supplement represents the merest fraction of odds and ends that can be found in this land of darkness.

boardgame.name: Roguish Archetype: Hell Breaker
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bring the Avernus to your table with this new Roguish Archetype.

In this new supplement for Baldur’s Gate: Descent into Avernus, you are introduced to the Roguish Archetype the Hell breaker, a rogue who likes nothing better than to break into the citadels and treasure vaults of the Nine Hells doing right under the devil’s noses.

The Hell breaker is a rogue spell caster who unique abilities allow them to plunder the Domains of powerful devils with the Devils being none the wiser. This roguish archetype is perfect for adventuring groups playing the Descent into Avernus adventure path or just mucking about in the Nine Hells. The fun, flavorful subclass brings a lot of versatility to any adventuring party.

boardgame.name: Plantations of Karnataka
boardgame.description:
Karnataka´ coffee production is especially renowned for its classic method of cultivating the seed and the cautious care the farmers pay to bring the best cup of coffee to the table. Are you up for the challenge and maintain the best plantation in the whole state across its different districts?

In Plantations of Karnataka players will be assuming the role of coffee farmers and move around their plantations aiming to harvest as many coffee beans as possible.

AIM OF THE GAME
Maintain the best coffee plantation and harvest the largest number of coffee beans before running out of moves.

COMPONENTS
Printed sheets and pen/pencil for each player. 2 Dice of different colours.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: 101 Necromancer Trinkets & Minor Items
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This supplement introduces 101 Trinkets & Minor Items that you may find in a necromancer’s tower.

The trinkets presented in this supplement are inspired by the gothic horror genre and will bring an additional layer of depth to any Horror adventure or 5e campaign. Many of the trinkets & Minor Items are designed as plot devices to inspire side quests and one-shot adventures. Also included are twenty items to make your encounters with necromancers more interesting and deadly.

What included

101 Necromancer inspired Trinkets

20 Necromancer & Arcane Magic Items

boardgame.name: Unearthed Spoils (Volume IV - Dipped in Poison)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Each volume of Unearthed Spoils is to be roughly 20-30 pages and packed with full-color art (lovingly created by Bob Greyvenstein), illustrating different types of 5e compatible content surrounding a central theme: Magic Items, Classes & Archetypes, Magical Spells, Monsters & NPCs, New Ancestries, and Short Adventures. Support us on Patreon to receive our D&D5e Unearthed Spoils Digital Magazine at a discount: patreon.com/grimpress

Unearthed Spoils Digital Magazine – Volume IV contains the following:
AN INTRODUCTION TO POISONS – Some useful rules and terminology on poisons, venoms, and toxins.
POISONER’S TOOLKIT – Kits, equipment, reagents, and recipe books for harvesting, refining, and synthesizing poisons.
MAGICAL SPELLS – New poison-based spells to incorporate into your adventures.
ARCHETYPES – Handling deadly poisons takes considerable attention to detail. Introducing the Poison Master rogue —few are more equipped for the task.
GM VARIANT RULE: HARVESTING, PRESERVING, &REFINING POISONS – A series of expanded rules for harvesting, preserving, and refining poisons from natural sources, as well as several examples.
GM VARIANT RULE: SYNTHESIZING POISONS – A series of expanded rules for synthesizing and creating new poisons.

boardgame.name: Unearthed Spoils (Volume V - Surviving the Arctic)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Each volume of Unearthed Spoils is roughly 15+ pages and packed with full-color art (lovingly created by Bob Greyvenstein), illustrating different types of 5e compatible content surrounding a central theme: Magic Items, Classes & Archetypes, Magical Spells, Monsters & NPCs, New Ancestries, and Short Adventures. Support us on Patreon to receive our Unearthed Spoils Digital Magazine at a discount: https://www.patreon.com/grimpress

Unearthed Spoils Digital Magazine – Volume V contains the following:

MAGIC ITEM SET - Rebuffing the cold's deathly grip, this magic item set allows its wearer to survive in an arctic environment.
MAGIC ITEMS FOUND IN THE ARCTIC - Items imbued with magical properties might be hard to find in the frozen wastes, but they do exist.
MAGICAL SPELLS - Spells designed to freeze your foes or bolster your defenses by harnessing winter's chill.
ARCHETYPES - Three new subclasses that favor the cold tundra.
GM VARIANT RULE: COLD WEATHER TRAVEL & RESTING - Rules outlining the hinderances of various cold weather conditions when taking a long rest, given a player's general preparedness.
ENCOUNTER: FROZEN KEEP DEFENSE - Defending the Frozen Keep is a short encounter for Game Masters to drop into a long-running campaign.

boardgame.name: Voidtouched
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Long ago, we left behind our natural home. Now, we traverse the heavens, traversing an endless and enigmatic void never meant for us. All we knew for all our existance - the sun, the horizon, even our natural gravity - is long behind us. It is time we become more like the void that is our home or be lost like a stranger in the dark.

To be Voidtouched is to understand that the grand mysteries of space require more than mundane, rational thinking. If the unexplained is commonplace, then perhaps you need new explanations.

The Voidtouched is a 1e-compatible player class for the Mothership Sci-Fi Horror RPG.

boardgame.name: Space Lion
boardgame.description:
There are alien armies on all fronts! Take command of one of four asymmetric armies in a huge battle and deploy your units strategically and carefully. You can't possibly win all the fights on the battlefield. Choose which battles to resolve in which order but weigh in on how it may affect your units and other battles.

In Space Lion, you are managing an army of 7 cards. Each round, you will decide where to deploy cards to battle. Use your battle effects with careful timing to win the battle in as many lanes as possible. You can't win them all! The player with the highest Strength in a lane wins, causing damage to the towers or bases of other players connected to that lane. Destroy all enemy bases to win!

Choose between 4 different asymmetrical armies each with their own unique systems and concerns on the battlefield. Then choose a hero for your army. Each army has 7 heroes to choose from which warp your strategy even further!

—description from the designer

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Amazons Vs Valkyries: Backgrounds and Homelands
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

While the backgrounds in the 5e core rules cover nearly every role in the ancient world, there are a few missing. In this file, we provide six additional backgrounds that help cover all the possible backgrounds a character in the Amazons vs Valkyries setting might have. These are:

Athlete. Many people have a background in athletics, whether it is racing, lifting, wresting, or team sports.

Farmer. Perhaps the most common background in the ancient world, farmers are ubiquitous in nearly every society.

Exile. Individuals, clans, or entire communities might be forced from their homes and cast into the wilderness. You might have been convicted of a crime or perhaps you were affiliated with a political or religious group that has been exiled.

Huntress. Despite the prevalence of cities and advances in agriculture, many people still prefer to hunt their food in the wilds. Others hunt because they don't have a choice.

Professional. The Professional background overlaps slightly with the Sage, but also covers lawyers, doctors, tax collectors, clerks, accountants, auditors, customs inspectors, managers, and anyone else who keeps businesses and bureaucracies moving.

Slave. In ancient times up to 30% of the population was in some sort of servitude. Therefore slavery is a possible background for players in this setting.

Homelands

This file also includes updated Homeland and Starting Language rules from the AvV Campaign Primer. This table can be used to randomly determine your homeland and language, or you can choose.
